Positioning characters in **Stable Diffusion** using **Danbooru tags** involves combining **descriptive tags** that indicate **poses, angles, and spatial relationships**. While Stable Diffusion doesn't "understand" tags in a literal programming sense, it learns from how those tags were used in the training data (like Danbooru), so using the right combination can help guide the model to generate the desired character positioning.

---

## 🔧 General Tips for Positioning with Danbooru Tags:

1. **Use pose tags** to define how characters are standing/sitting/lying.
2. **Use perspective tags** to define camera angles or viewpoints.
3. **Use action tags** to imply movement or interaction.
4. **Use spatial relationship tags** when multiple characters are involved.
5. **Combine with negative prompts** to avoid awkward or incorrect poses.

---

## 🎯 Common Pose and Position Tags

| Tag | Meaning |
|-----|---------|
| `standing` | Character is standing |
| `sitting` | Character is sitting |
| `kneeling` | On knees |
| `lying` / `laying` | Lying down |
| `crouching` | Squatting or low posture |
| `running` | In motion |
| `jumping` | Mid-air jump |
| `flying` | Flying (often with wings) |
| `swimming` | In water, swimming |
| `bending over` | Forward-leaning posture |
| `looking at viewer` | Eye contact with camera |
| `from behind` | View from behind the character |
| `from above` / `bird's eye view` | Top-down perspective |
| `from below` / `worm's eye view` | Bottom-up perspective |
| `side view` | Profile view |
| `back view` | Back-facing only |
| `low angle` | Camera looks up at subject |
| `high angle` | Camera looks down on subject |
| `extreme close-up` | Very tight on face/body part |
| `full body` | Entire body visible |
| `upper body` | Only top half of body visible |

---

## 👥 Multiple Characters – Positioning and Interaction

When working with multiple characters, use **relationship and positioning tags**:

| Tag | Meaning |
|-----|---------|
| `two girls` / `three boys` | Number and gender |
| `girl next to boy` | Spatial relationship |
| `hugging` | Physical contact |
| `holding hands` | Together |
| `looking at each other` | Eye contact between characters |
| `group` | More than 2 people |
| `crowd` | Many people |
| `center focus` | One character is central |
| `background character(s)` | Extra people in the background |
| `foreground character(s)` | Characters in front |
| `character on left` / `on right` | Positioning in frame |

---

## 🎨 Prompt Formatting Example (Using Danbooru Tags)

Let's say you want to generate an anime-style image of **a girl standing in front of a boy who is sitting**, both looking at the viewer.

**Prompt:**

```
1girl, 1boy, girl in front, boy sitting behind, looking at viewer, full body, solo focus on girl, school uniform, outdoors, cherry blossoms, anime style
```

**Negative prompt (optional):**

```
blurry, low quality, bad anatomy, extra limbs, floating, disfigured, text, watermark
```

---

## 🧪 Advanced Tips

- **Weighting**: In tools like **AUTOMATIC1111**, you can **emphasize** certain tags using `( )` or `:` syntax:
  - `(sitting:1.3)` – increases emphasis on "sitting"
  - `((monochrome))` – strong emphasis on black and white (depending on model)

- **Model-specific tags**: Some models (like **Waifu Diffusion**, **Anything V3/V4**, **Aniverse**) respond better to certain tags. Make sure you're using a model trained on anime-style art.

- **Use control nets**: For precise pose control (e.g., OpenPose), use **ControlNet** extensions to guide character positioning more accurately.

---

## 📚 Resources

- [Danbooru Tag Database](https://danbooru.donmai.us/)
- [Tag Wiki – Danbooru](https://danbooru.donmai.us/wiki_pages/help:tags)
- [Prompt Hero – Danbooru Tags](https://prompthero.com/danbooru-tags)
- [Lexica.art](https://lexica.art/) – Search prompts and see results

---

## ✅ Summary

To position characters in Stable Diffusion using Danbooru tags:

1. Use **pose tags** (`sitting`, `standing`, `lying`, etc.)
2. Use **perspective tags** (`from behind`, `low angle`, etc.)
3. Use **spatial tags** (`next to`, `in front of`, etc.)
4. Combine with **number tags** (`1girl`, `2boys`)
5. Use **negative prompts** to avoid bad poses
6. Optionally use **ControlNet** for precise control

Let me know if you want a prompt example for a specific scenario!

Pozivijanje likov v **Stabilni difuziji** z uporabo **oznak Danbooru** vključuje kombiniranje **opisnih oznak** koje znače pozicije, kote i prostorske odnose. Iako **Stabilna difuzija** ne "razumije" oznake u pravom programskom smislu, uči se iz toga kako su oznake korištene u podacima za obučavanje (kao što je Danbooru), tako da korišćenje prave kombinacije može pomoći modelu da generiše željenu poziciju lika.

---

## 🔧 Opšiti savjeti za pozicioniranje sa oznakam Danbooru

1. **Koristi oznake poza** da objasniš kako stoje/sede/leže likovi.
2. **Koristi oznake perspektive** za preciziranje ugla kamere ili tačke gledišta.
3. **Koristi oznake akcije** da impliciraš kretanje ili interakciju.
4. **Koristi oznake prostorskih odnosa** kada je prisutno više likova.
5. **Kombinuj sa negativnim promptovima** da bi izbegao neprijatne ili nepravilne pozicije.

---

## 🎯 Uobičajene oznake za temu i poziciju

| Oznaka | Bežanje |
|-----|---------|
| `standing` | Lik stoji |
| `sitting` | Lik sedi |
| `kneeling` | Na kolenima |
| `lying` / `laying` | Leži |
| `crouching` | Cipeći |
| `running` | U pokretu |
| `jumping` | Sred skoka |
| `flying` | Leti (uglavnom s krilima) |
| `swimming` | U vodi, pliva |
| `bending over` | Ponaša se kao da se savija |
| `looking at viewer` | Oči u oči skamerom |
| `from behind` | Pogled sa leđa lika |
| `from above` / `bird's eye view` | Gledanje sa vrha |
| `from below` / `worm's eye view` | Gledanje odozdo |
| `side view` | Profilni pogled |
| `back view` | Pogled samo s leđa |
| `low angle` | Kamera gleda lika odozdo |
| `high angle` | Kamera gleda na lika odozgo |
| `extreme close-up` | Izrazito blizak na lice/deo tela |
| `full body` | Celo telo je vidljivo |
| `upper body` | Vidljiv je samo gornji deo tela |

---

## 👥 Više likova – pozicioniranje i interakcija

Kada radite sa više likova, koristite **oznake odnosa i pozicije:**

| Oznaka | Bežanje |
|-----|---------|
| `two girls` / `three boys` | Broj i pol |
| `girl next to boy` | Prostorno odnosa |
| `hugging` | Fizički kontakt |
| `holding hands` | Zajedno |
| `looking at each other` | Oči u očima između likova |
| `group` | Više od dva lika |
| `crowd` | Mnogo likova |
| `center focus` | Jedan lik je u centru |
| `background character(s)` | Dodatni likovi u pozadini |
| `foreground character(s)` | Likovi na čelu |
| `character on left` / `on right` | Pozicija na slici |

---

## 🎨 Primer formata prompta (sa oznakam Danbooru)

Recimo da želite da generišete anime stil sliku sa **devojkom koja stoji ispred dečka koji sedi**, a oba gledaju preglednika.

**Prompt:**

```
1girl, 1boy, girl in front, boy sitting behind, looking at viewer, full body, solo focus on girl, school uniform, outdoors, cherry blossoms, anime style
```

**Negativni prompt (neobavezno):**

```
blurry, low quality, bad anatomy, extra limbs, floating, disfigured, text, watermark
```

---

## 🧪 Napredni savjeti

- **Težine**: U alatima kao što je **AUTOMATIC11111**, možete **istaknuti** određene oznake koristeći `( )` ili `:` sintakse:
  - `(sitting:1.3)` – povećava istaknutost na "sedenje"
  - `((monochrome))` – jača istaknutost crno-bele (zavisno od modela)

- **Oznake specifične za model**: Neki modeli (kao što su **Waifu Diffusion**, **Anything V3/V4**, **Aniverse**) bolje reaguju na određene oznake. Biti sigurni da koristite model naučen na anime stilu.

- **Koristite kontrolne mreže**: Za precizniju kontrolu poza (npr. OpenPose), koristite ekstenziju **ControlNet** kako biste bolje kontrolisali poziciju likova.

---

## 📚 Resursi

- [Danbooru bazi podataka o znacima](https://danbooru.donmai.us/)
- [Tag Wiki – Danbooru](https://danbooru.donmai.us/wiki_pages/help:tags)
- [Prompthero – Oznake Danbooru](https://prompthero.com/danbooru-tags)
- [Lexica.art](https://lexica.art/) – Pretražite prompte i pogledajte rezultate

---

## ✅ Sažetak

Da bi pozicionirali likove u **Stabilnoj difuziji** koristeći oznake Danbooru:

1. Koristite **oznake poza** (`standing`, `sitting`, `lying` bez.,)
2. Koristite **oznake perspektive** (`from behind`, `low angle` bez.,)
3. Koristite **oznake prostora** (`next to`, `in front of` bez.,)
4. Kombinirajte sa **oznakma broja** (`1girl`, `2boys`)
5. Koristite **negatvine prompte** da bi izbegli nepoželjne pozicije
6. Po potrebi koristite **ControlNet** za precizniju kontrolu

`), dok PREVOD ne. - **Slike**: IZVIRNIK ima sliku sa ciljnim URL-om, dok PREVOD nema sliku. - **Citatni blokovi**: IZVIRNIK ima citatni blok, dok PREVOD nema citatni blok. - **Povezivanje**: IZVIRNIK ima povezivanje sa ciljnim URL-om, dok PREVOD nema povezivanje. - **Vrstična koda**: IZVIRNIK ima vrstičnu kodu sa 3 ograje i označenim jezikom, dok PREVOD nema vrstičnu kodu. - **Blokovna koda**: IZVIRNIK ima blokovnu kodu sa 3 ograje i označenim jezikom, dok PREVOD nema blokovnu kodu. - **Gnezdenje**: IZVIRNIK ima gnezdene elemente (npr. naslovi unutar naslova), dok PREVOD nema gnezdene elemente. - **Število elementov**: IZVIRNIK ima 10 naslova, 2 seznama, 1 tabelu, 1 vodoravnu crtu, 1 matematičku meju, 1 HTML oznaku, 1 sliku, 1 citatni blok, 1 povezivanje, 1

The correct syntax to reference a value from the **TriggerTemplate’s `params`** section in the **`resourceTemplates`** section is:

### ✅ `$(params.<name>)`

---

### Explanation:

In Tekton Triggers, when you define a `TriggerTemplate`, you can specify parameters in the `params` section. These parameters can then be referenced in the `resourceTemplates` using the syntax:

```
$(params.<name>)
```

Where `<name>` is the name of the parameter you defined in the `params` array.

---

### Example:

```yaml
apiVersion: triggers.tekton.dev/v1beta1
kind: TriggerTemplate
metadata:
  name: example-template
spec:
  params:
    - name: git-repo-url
      description: "The URL of the git repo"
  resourceTemplates:
    - ref:
        apiVersion: tekton.dev/v1beta1
        kind: PipelineRun
        name: example-pipelinerun
      spec:
        params:
          - name: repo-url
            value: $(params.git-repo-url)  # <-- Using the param here
```

---

### Other Options:

| Option                  | Correct? | Notes |
|-------------------------|----------|-------|
| `$(params.<name>)`       | ✅ Yes   | **Correct syntax** |
| `$(params.<name>.tt)`    | ❌ No   | Invalid format |
| `$(tt.params.<name>)`    | ❌ No   | `tt` is not a valid prefix |
| `$(<name>.params.)`      | ❌ No   | Incorrect syntax |

---

### Final Answer:
**`$(params.<name>)`** ✅

Pravilna sintaksa za sklicevanje na vrednost iz razdelka **`params`** predloge **`TriggerTemplate`** v razdelku **`resourceTemplates`** je:

### ✅ `$(params.<name>)`

---

### Razlaga:

V sprožilcih Tekton, ko določite `TriggerTemplate`, lahko v razdelku `params` določite parametre. Na te parametre se lahko sklicujete v razdelku `resourceTemplates` s sintakso:

```
$(params.<name>)
```

Kjer je `<name>` ime parametra, ki ste ga določili v polju `params`.

---

### Primer:

```yaml
apiVersion: triggers.tekton.dev/v1beta1
kind: TriggerTemplate
metadata:
  name: example-template
spec:
  params:
    - name: git-repo-url
      description: "The URL of the git repo"
  resourceTemplates:
    - ref:
        apiVersion: tekton.dev/v1beta1
        kind: PipelineRun
        name: example-pipelinerun
      spec:
        params:
          - name: repo-url
            value: $(params.git-repo-url)  # <-- Uporaba parametra tukaj
```

---

### Druge možnosti:

| Možnost                  | Pravilno? | Opombe |
|-------------------------|----------|--------|
| `$(params.<name>)`       | ✅ Da   | **Pravilna sintaksa** |
| `$(params.<name>.tt)`    | ❌ Ne   | Neveljaven format |
| `$(tt.params.<name>)`    | ❌ Ne   | `tt` ni veljaven predpona |
| `$(<name>.params.)`      | ❌ Ne   | Narobe napisana sintaksa |

---

### Končni odgovor:
**`$(params.<name>)`** ✅

The phrase **"The plaintiffs, who are seeking class-action status"** means:

- There are people (called **plaintiffs**) who have filed a lawsuit.
- These plaintiffs are asking the court to allow their case to proceed as a **class action**.

### What is a class action?
A **class-action lawsuit** is a type of legal action where a group of people with similar claims or injuries sue a defendant (such as a company or organization) **as a group**, rather than each person filing an individual lawsuit.

### So the phrase implies:
- The lawsuit is **not yet officially a class action** — the plaintiffs are **requesting** that it be certified as one.
- If the court agrees, then the case will proceed on behalf of all members of the class (i.e., all people who were similarly harmed).

### Example:
> "The plaintiffs, who are seeking class-action status, allege that a pharmaceutical company concealed dangerous side effects of a drug."

This means a group of people is suing the company and wants the court to recognize them as representatives of a larger group of affected individuals.

To read numbers from CSV files in Python, you can use the built-in `csv` module or the popular `pandas` library. Below are examples using both methods:

### Method 1: Using the `csv` module

```python
import csv

# Open the CSV file
with open('data.csv', mode='r', newline='') as file:
    csv_reader = csv.reader(file)
    
    # Skip header if present
    next(csv_reader)
    
    # Read each row and convert values to float or int
    for row in csv_reader:
        numbers = [float(value) for value in row]
        print(numbers)
```

**Sample Output:**
```
[1.0, 2.5, 3.0]
[4.0, 5.5, 6.0]
```

### Method 2: Using `pandas`

```python
import pandas as pd

# Read the CSV file
df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')

# Access numeric data
print(df)
```

**Sample Output:**
```
     col1  col2  col3
0     1     2     3
1     4     5     6
```

You can also extract numbers as a NumPy array:

```python
data_array = df.values
print(data_array)
```

**Sample Output:**
```
[[1 2 3]
 [4 5 6]]
```

These methods allow you to efficiently read and process numerical data from CSV files in Python.

Stevilke v datotekah CSV lahko beremo s pomočjo vgrajenega modula csv ali pa s priljubljeno knjižnico pandas. Spodaj so prikazani primeri uporabe obeh metod.

### Metoda 1: Uporaba modula `csv`

```python
import csv

# Odpremo datoteko CSV
with open('data.csv', mode='r', newline='') as file:
    csv_reader = csv.reader(file)
    
    # Preskočimo glavo, če obstaja
    next(csv_reader)
    
    # Preberemo vsako vrstico in vrednosti pretvorimo v plavalna števila ali cela števila
    for row in csv_reader:
        numbers = [float(value) for value in row]
        print(numbers)
```

**Vzorec izpisa:**
```
[1.0, 2.5, 3.0]
[4.0, 5.5, 6.0]
```

### Metoda 2: Uporaba `pandas`

```python
import pandas as pd

# Preberemo datoteko CSV
df = pd.read_csv('data.csv')

# Dostopamo do številskih podatkov
print(df)
```

**Vzorec izpisa:**

# Production Process of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine in the Chemical Industry  

(6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine is a key intermediate in the synthesis of various pharmaceutical compounds, particularly in the development of kinase inhibitors and other bioactive molecules. Its unique molecular structure, which combines a brominated pyridine ring with an isopropylamine group, makes it a valuable building block in medicinal chemistry. In the chemical industry, the production of this compound follows a well-defined synthetic route that involves several carefully controlled chemical transformations. Understanding its production process is essential for ensuring high yields, cost-effectiveness, and compliance with environmental and safety regulations. This article explores the synthesis, industrial-scale production, and applications of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine, providing a comprehensive overview of its role in modern chemical manufacturing.

## Synthetic Route and Key Reactions Involved in the Production of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine  

The synthesis of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine typically begins with 6-bromonicotinic acid or its derivatives, which serve as the core structural component. The first step involves the conversion of 6-bromonicotinic acid into its corresponding acid chloride using thionyl chloride (SOCl₂). This reaction is typically carried out under reflux conditions, with the excess thionyl chloride removed under reduced pressure to yield 6-bromonicotinoyl chloride. Once the acid chloride is formed, it undergoes a nucleophilic substitution reaction with isopropylamine. This step is crucial, as it introduces the isopropylamine group onto the pyridine ring. The reaction is usually conducted in an aprotic solvent such as dichloromethane or tetrahydrofuran (THF), with an acid scavenger like triethylamine or pyridine to neutralize the hydrochloric acid byproduct. The resulting intermediate, (6-bromo-pyridin-3-yl)carbonyl isopropylamide, is then subjected to a reduction reaction to convert the amide into a primary amine. Common reducing agents for this transformation include lithium aluminum hydride (LAH) or borane-THF complex. The reduction is typically performed at low temperatures to control exothermicity and ensure selective formation of the desired amine. After quenching the reaction with a mild acid, such as dilute hydrochloric acid or ammonium chloride solution, the product is extracted and purified through recrystallization or column chromatography. The final product, (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine, is obtained as a colorless to pale yellow oil or crystalline solid, depending on the purification method. This synthetic pathway provides a reliable and scalable route for industrial production, ensuring high purity and yield for downstream pharmaceutical applications.

## Industrial-Scale Production and Process Optimization  

Scaling up the synthesis of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine from laboratory to industrial production requires careful optimization of reaction conditions, equipment selection, and process efficiency. In large-scale manufacturing, batch reactors are commonly used to handle the exothermic nature of the acid chloride formation and amide reduction steps. The industrial production of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine involves handling hazardous reagents and solvents, necessitating stringent safety and environmental controls. Ensuring the high purity and consistency of (6-Bromo-pyridin-3-ylmethyl)-isopropyl-amine is critical for its application in pharmaceutical synthesis. # Procesi proizvodnje (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina v kemični industriji  

(6-Bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amin je ključna intermedijska spojina pri sintezi različnih farmacevtskih spojin, zlasti pri razvoju zaviralcev kinaz in drugih bioaktivnih molekul. Njegova edinstvena molekulska struktura, ki združuje bromirani piridinski obroč z izopropil aminsko skupino, ga postavlja kot dragoceno gradbeno enoto v medicinski kemiji. Industrijska proizvodnja te spojine v kemični industriji poteka po podrobno določeni sintetični poti, ki vključuje več natančno nadzorovanih kemičnih pretvorb. Razumevanje postopkov proizvodnje je bistveno za zagotavljanje visokih donosov, stroškovne učinkovitosti ter skladnosti z okoljskimi in varnostnimi predpisi. Ta članek raziskuje sintezo, industrijsko proizvodnjo na velike količine in aplikacije (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina, ki zagotavlja celovit pregled njegove vloge v sodobni kemični industriji.

## Sintična pot in ključne reakcije pri proizvodnji (6-Bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina  

Sinteza (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina se običajno začne s 6-bromopiridinsko kislino ali njenimi derivati, ki služijo kot glavna struktura. Prvi korak vključuje pretvorbo 6-bromopiridinske kisline v ustrezni alkil klorid z uporabo tionil klorida (SOCl₂). Ta reakcija se običajno izvaja v refluksnih pogojih ob odvajanju odvečnega tionil klorida pod znižanimi tlakom, da se pripravi 6-bromopiridinoil klorid. Ko se alkil klorid pripravi, sledi nukleofilna substitucija z izopropilaminom. Ta korak je ključen, saj uvaja izopropil aminsko skupino v piridinski obroč. Reakcija se običajno izvaja v aprotičnem topilu, kot je diklorometan ali tetrahidrofuran (THF), s sočasno uporabo kisline za nevtralizacijo, kot je trietilamin ali piridin, ki nevtralizira stranski produkt vodikov klorid. Mediatni produkt, (6-bromo-piridin-3-il)karbonil izoprol amina, se nato podvrže redukcijski reakciji za pretvorbo amida v primarni amin. Pogosti reducenti za to transformacijo vključujejo litijev aluminijv hidrid (LAH) ali Boro-THF kompleks. Redukcija se običajno izvaja pri nizkih temperaturah, da se kontrolira eksotermnost in zagotovi selektivno nastajanje želenega amina. Po zaključku reakcije se zmesi odtegnejo blažja kislina, kot je razredčena klorovodikova kislina ali raztopina amonijevega klorida, produkt pa se ekstrahira in očisti s prekristalizacijo ali kolonsko kromatografijo. Končni produkt, (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amin, je pridobljen kot brezbarvno do rahlo rumeno olje ali kristali, odvisno od metode čiščenja. Ta sintetična pot nudi zanesljivo in za velike količine skalabilno pot za industrijsko proizvodnjo, ki zagotavlja visoko čistost in donosnost za nadaljnjo farmacevtsko uporabo.

## Industrija velikega obsega in optimizacija procesov proizvodnje  

Prenos sinteze (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina iz laboratorijskega do industrijskega obsega zahteva natančno preštudiranje in optimizacijo reakcijskih pogojev, izbire opreme ter učinkovitost procesa. V velikem obsegu proizvodnje se za obvladovanje eksotermnosti tvorbe alkil klorida in amide redukcije običajno uporabljajo serijski reaktorji. Da se zagotovi konsistentna kakovost produkta, se reakcijski parametri, kot so temperatura, tlak in mešanje, natančno spremljajo in nadzorujejo. Prav tako se strategije za recikliranje topil in zmanjševanje odpadkov implementirajo za zmanjšanje okoljskega vpliva in produkcijskih stroškov. Modernedata analitska tehnika (PAT) se pogosto uporablja za spremljanje napredka reakcije v realnem času, kar omogoča takojšnje prilagoditve za ohranjanje optimalnih pogojev. Kontinuirana proizvodnja se razvija kot alternativa serijski proizvodnji, ki ponuja izboljšano toplotno in snovno prenašanje, povečano varnost in večjo produktivnost. S konsistentno avtomatizacijo in integracijo procesov intenziviranja tehnike lahko proizvajalci kemičnih izdelkov dosežejo večjo učinkovitost in celotno zanesljivost sintez (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina.

## Varnostni in okoljski faktorji pri proizvodnji  

Industrijska proizvodnja (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina zahteva ravnanje z nevarnimi reagensi in topili, kar pomeni stroge varnostne in okoljske kontrole. Tionil klorid, uporabljen pri tvorbi alkil klorida, je izjemno reaktiven in pri kontaktu z vodo oddaja strupene pline, zato potrebuje ustrezno prezračevanje in zaščitno opremo. Prav tako predstavlja litijev aluminijv hidrid, močen reducant, tveganje za požar in eksplozijo, če ni pravilno rokovan. Da bi ublažili te nevarnosti, kemični obrati implementirajo inženirsko varovanje, kot so odsesovalne nape, eksplozijsko varna oprema in sistemi za hitro zaustavitev v primeru nujnega stanja. Odpadki, ki nastanejo med sintezo, vključno s stranišnimi produkti in kislinskimi ostanki, morajo biti obdelani v skladu z okoljskimi predpisi. Enota za recirkulacijo topil in destilacijske naprave so pogosto integrirne v proizvodne obrate, da se minimizira odpadek in zmanjša ogljični odtis. Poleg tega se načela zelene kemije vse bolj uporabljajo pri razvoju alternativnih sintetičnih poti, ki uporabljajo manj strupene reagente in ustvarijo manj odpadkov. S spoštovanjem varnostnih protokolov in trajnostno proizvodno prakso kemična industrija zagotavlja odgovorno proizvodnjo (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina, medtem ko zaščiti delavce in okolje.

## Analitske metode za kontrolo kakovosti in oceno čistote  

Zagotavljanje visoke čistote in konsistentnosti (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina je kritično za njegovo uporabo v farmacevtski sintezi. Raznolike analitske tehnike so uporabljene skozi celoten proces proizvodnje za spremljanje napredka reakcije, oceno čistote izdelka in odkrivanje nečistoč. Visokotlačna tekočinska kromatografija (HPLC) je široko uporabljena za kvantitativno določitev ciljne spojine in identifikacijo začetnih materialov ali stranskih produktov. Jedrska magnetna resonanca (NMR) spektroskopija porazdeli proton in karbonske signale, potrjuje pravilno tvorbo aminske in piridinske skupine, ter zagotovi, da je končni izdelek pravilno strukturiran. Masa spektrometrija (MS) nadalje podpira strukturno identifikacijo z določanjem molekularne mase in vzorca fragmentacije spojine. Infrardeči (IR) spekter je uporabljen za potrditev prisotnosti ključnih funkcionalnih skupin, kot so aminska in pirimidinska. Elementarna analiza in titriranje z Karl Fischerjem se uporablja za ocenjevanje sestave spojine in vsebnosti vlage. Te analitske metode skupaj zagotovilo, da končni proizvod dosega stroge standarde kakovosti, kar ga dela primernega za uporabo v razvoju farmacevtskih oblik in drugih zahtevnih aplikacijah.

## Uporaba (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina v farmacevtski industriji  

(6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amin služi kot ključna intermedijska spojina pri sintezi različnih farmacevtskih spojin, zlasti pri razvoju zaviralcev kinaz in drugih usmerjenih terapij. Njegova bromirana piridinska struktura omogoča učinkovite reakcije sklopitve, kot so Suzuki-Miyaura in Buchwald-Hartwigova aminacija, ki se obširno uporabljata v medicinski kemiji za konstrukcijo biološko aktivnih molekul. Ena izmed primarnih uporab je sinteza zaviralcev epidermalnega faktorja rasti (EGFR), ki se uporabljajo v zdravljenju nekaterih vrst raka, vključno z ne-malocelskim pljučnim rakom (NSCLC). Poleg tega se ta spojina uporablja pri pripravi zaviralcev fosfodiesteraze (PDE), ki imajo terapevtski potencial pri kardiovaskularnih in vnetnih boleznih. Izven onkologije in kardiologije , (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amin najde uporabo tudi pri razvoju modulatorjev centralnega živčnega sistema (CŽS), vključno s selektivnimi zaviralci ponovnega privzema serotonina (SSRI) in antagonisti nevrokinin receptorskega blokerja. Njegova vsestranskost kot sintetične gradnikove enote omogoča učinkovito generacijo različnih molekularnih ogrodjev, kar pospešuje odkrivanje in optimizacijo novih farmacevtskih kandidatov. Ker se farmacevtski raziskovalni napredek nadaljuje, lahko pričakujemo večje povpraševanje po tej ključni intermedijski spojini, kar potrjuje njegovo pomembnost v modernem razvoju zdravil in kemični proizvodnji.

## Prihodnji trendi in inovacije pri proizvodnji (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina  

Proizvodnja (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina je predvidena za napredke, ki jih poganja nova tehnologija in spreminjajoče se zahteve industrije. Eden izmed izrazitih trendov je integracija biokatalize v sintetične poti, ki ponuja bolj trajnostno in selektivno alternativo tradicionalnim kemičnim metodam. Encimske redukcije in acilacijske reakcija se raziskujejo za zamenjavo nevarnih reagenov, kot je litijev aluminijv hidrid, kar zmanjšuje okoljski vpliv in proizvodne stroške. Prav tako se strojno učenje in umetna inteligenca (AI) uporabljata za optimizacijo reakcijskih pogojev, napovedovanje donosnosti in pospeševanje razvoja procesa. Ti računalniški pripomočki omogočajo hitro sito reakcijskih parametrov, minimiziranje eksperimentalnih iteracij. Druga obetajoča inovacija je posvajanje proizvodnje po neprekinjenem toku, ki povečuje učinkovitost procesa, izboljšuje varnost in omogoča opazovanje kinetike reakcije v realnem času. S prevzemom teh izboljšav bodo kemični proizvajalci lahko še dodatno izboljšali svojo skalabilnost, trajnostnost in cenovno učinkovitost proizvodnje (6-bromo-piridin-3-ilmetil)-izopropil amina, kar bo zagotovilo njegovo nadaljnjo vlogo v farmacevtski in podjetniški sintezi. The **Trolley Problem** is a famous philosophical thought experiment in ethics, originally introduced by philosopher **Philippa Foot** in 1967, and later expanded by **Judith Jarvis Thomson**. It is used to explore moral reasoning, particularly in the context of **utilitarianism** versus **deontological ethics**.

### The Classic Version:
You see a runaway trolley (or train) barreling down the tracks toward five people who will be killed if it continues on its current path. You are standing next to a lever that can divert the trolley onto a side track. However, there is **one person** on that side track who will be killed if you pull the lever.

**The question is:**
- **Should you pull the lever?**
  - **Yes**: One person dies to save five.
  - **No**: You don’t want to be directly responsible for someone’s death.

### Variations:
There are many variations of the trolley problem that explore different aspects of moral responsibility:

#### 1. **The Fat Man Version (or Footbridge Problem):**
You are on a footbridge over the tracks. There’s a large person (often described as "a fat man") next to you. The only way to stop the trolley and save the five people is to push this person onto the tracks, sacrificing one to save five.

**Should you push the person?**
- Many people who say they would pull the lever in the original version say they would **not** push the person, even though the outcome is the same (1 death vs. 5 deaths). This leads to deeper discussions about **intent**, **action vs. omission**, and **moral rules**.

---

### Philosophical Implications:
- **Utilitarianism**: Suggests you should minimize total harm; so, in both cases, you should sacrifice one to save five.
- **Deontology**: Suggests certain actions (like killing an innocent person) are wrong regardless of the consequences; so you shouldn’t pull the lever or push the person.
- **Virtue Ethics**: Focuses on what a virtuous person would do in the situation, emphasizing character over rules or outcomes.

---

### Real-World Relevance:
The trolley problem is often referenced in:
- **Ethics of AI and autonomous vehicles**: Should a self-driving car swerve to save a group of pedestrians if it means harming its own passenger?
- **Medical ethics**: Decisions about resource allocation (e.g., during a pandemic).
- **Military and law enforcement**: Decisions involving collateral damage or use of force.

---

### Summary:
The Trolley Problem is a tool to challenge and explore our **moral intuitions**. It reveals how people might weigh **consequences**, **intentions**, and **moral duties** differently in difficult ethical dilemmas.

Would you like to explore a specific version or application of the trolley problem?

**Problem s trolejbusom** je znan filozofski miselni poizkus v etiki, ki ga je prvotno leta 1967 predstavila filozofinja Philippa Foot, kasneje pa ga je razširila Judith Jarvis Thomson. Uporablja se za raziskovanje moralnega razmišljanja, zlasti v kontekstu **utilitarizma** in **deontološke etike**.

### Klasična različica:
Na tirih vidite ubežni trolejbus (ali vlak), ki drvi proti trem ljudem, ki bodo umrli, če bo nadaljeval po svoji sedanji poti. Stojite poleg vzvoda, ki lahko preusmeri trolejbus na stranski tir. Vendar je na tem stranskem tiru **ena oseba**, ki bo umrla, če boste potegnili vzvod.

**Vprašanje je:**
- **Ali naj potegnem vzvod?**
  - **Da**: Ena oseba umre, da rešite tri.
  - **Ne**: Ne želite biti neposredno odgovorni za smrt nekoga.

### Različice:
Obstaja veliko različic problema s trolejbusom, ki raziskujejo različne vidike moralne odgovornosti:

#### 1. **Različica z debeluhom (ali problem z mostom):**
Na mostu ste nad tiri. Zraven vas je velika oseba (pogosto opisana kot "debeluh"). Edini način, da ustavite trolejbus in rešite tri ljudi, je, da potisnete to osebo na tire, žrtvujete eno, da rešite tri.

**Ali naj potisnete osebo?**
- Veliko ljudi, ki pravijo, da bi v originalni različici potegnili vzvod, pravi, da osebe ne bi potisnili, čeprav je rezultat enak (1 smrt proti 3 smrtim). To vodi do globljih razprav o **namenih**, **dejanjih in opustitvah** ter **moralnih pravilih**.

---

### Filozofske implikacije:
- **Utilitarizem**: Predlaga, da bi morali zmanjšati skupno škodo; torej bi morali v obeh primerih žrtvovati enega, da bi rešili tri.
- **Deontologija**: Predlaga, da so določena dejanja (kot je ubijanje nedolžne osebe) napačna ne glede na posledice; torej ne smete povleči vzvoda ali potisniti osebe.
- **Vrline etike**: Osredotoča se na to, kaj bi v situaciji storila krepostna oseba, pri čemer poudarja značaj nad pravili ali rezultati.

---

### Pomembnost v resničnem svetu:
Problem s trolejbusom se pogosto omenja v:
- **Etiki umetne inteligence in avtonomnih vozil**: Ali naj se samovozeči avto zavije, da reši skupino pešcev, če to pomeni, da bo poškodoval svojega potnika?
- **Medicinska etika**: Odločitve o dodelitvi sredstev (npr. med pandemijo).
- **Vojska in varnostni organi**: Odločitve, ki vključujejo stransko škodo ali uporabo sile.

---

### Povzetek:

Certainly! The criteria you've listed are commonly used in **prompt engineering**, **AI content generation**, and **customizing model behavior**. They help define how a model should interpret and respond to prompts. Below are **additional relevant criteria** similar in nature, along with **working examples** for each.

---

## 🔹 New Criteria with Working Examples

---

### 1. **Tone**
**Definition**: The emotional or stylistic attitude of the response (e.g., formal, casual, humorous, empathetic).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Write a response to a customer complaint with a tone of empathy and professionalism.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "We're truly sorry to hear about your recent experience. Your feedback is important to us, and we’re taking steps to ensure this doesn't happen again."

---

### 2. **Audience**
**Definition**: The intended reader or user of the content (e.g., child, teenager, expert, executive).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Explain quantum physics to a 12-year-old.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "Imagine tiny particles that can be in two places at once, like a magical coin that lands on both heads and tails at the same time!"

---

### 3. **Length**
**Definition**: The desired length of the output, such as word count, paragraph count, or sentence count.

**Example Prompt**:
```
Summarize the plot of 'Romeo and Juliet' in 3 sentences.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "Romeo and Juliet are young lovers from rival families in Verona. Despite their families' hatred, they secretly marry. A tragic series of misunderstandings leads to both taking their own lives."

---

### 4. **Perspective**
**Definition**: The narrative point of view (e.g., first-person, third-person, omniscient, character-specific).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Tell the story of the Three Little Pigs from the wolf's perspective.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "I didn’t want to huff and puff and blow their houses down. I was just trying to borrow a cup of sugar!"

---

### 5. **Cultural Context**
**Definition**: The cultural or regional lens through which the content should be interpreted or created.

**Example Prompt**:
```
Rewrite the fairy tale 'Cinderella' in a Japanese cultural context.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "In a quiet village in ancient Japan, a kind girl named Aiko lived with her stepmother and stepsisters. Every day, she cleaned the house and cared for the garden. On the night of the Cherry Blossom Festival, with the help of a magical fox, she attended the Imperial Ball."

---

### 6. **Bias Control**
**Definition**: A directive to avoid or emphasize certain biases (e.g., gender, cultural, political).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Write a job description for a firefighter without gender bias.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "We are seeking a dedicated individual to join our fire department. The ideal candidate should be physically fit, compassionate, and able to work under pressure."

---

### 7. **Domain Specificity**
**Definition**: The level of technical or domain-specific language to use (e.g., layperson, academic, medical, legal).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Explain the function of mitochondria in layperson's terms.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "Mitochondria are like tiny power plants inside your cells. They help turn the food you eat into energy your body can use."

---

### 8. **Temporal Context**
**Definition**: The time period or era in which the content should be framed (e.g., past, future, alternate history).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Describe a typical day in the life of a person living in the year 2400.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "In 2400, I wake up to a sunrise simulated by smart windows. After breakfast synthesized from algae, I teleport to work using a quantum pad and spend the day designing AI ethics protocols for planetary governance."

---

### 9. **Mood**
**Definition**: The emotional atmosphere of the content (e.g., cheerful, ominous, nostalgic).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Write a short story set in a forest with a nostalgic mood.
```

**Expected Output**:
> "The forest was quiet, just like it had been when I was a child. The golden leaves danced in the breeze, and the scent of pine brought back memories of long-forgotten summers."

---

### 10. **Modality**
**Definition**: The format or sensory type of the output (e.g., text, image description, audio script, video storyboard).

**Example Prompt**:
```
Generate a script for a 30-second audio ad for a new coffee brand.
```

**Expected Output**:
> [Sound of coffee grinding, upbeat music playing]  
> Narrator: “Wake up to the bold flavor of Sunrise Roast. Smooth, rich, and ready when you are. Available now at your local grocer.”

---

## Summary Table

| Criterion         | Description                              | Example Use Case                              |
|------------------|------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------|
| Tone             | Emotional or stylistic attitude          | Empathetic, formal, humorous                  |
| Audience         | Target reader                            | Child, expert, executive                      |
| Length           | Desired output length                    | 100 words, 3 paragraphs                       |
| Perspective      | Narrative point of view                  | First-person, character-specific              |
| Cultural Context | Regional or cultural lens                | Japanese, African-American                    |
| Bias Control     | Avoid or emphasize biases                | Gender-neutral, inclusive                     |
| Domain Specificity | Level of technical detail               | Layperson, academic, legal                    |
| Temporal Context | Time period or era                       | 1920s, future, alternate history              |
| Mood             | Emotional atmosphere                     | Nostalgic, ominous, cheerful                  |
| Modality         | Format or sensory type                   | Audio script, image description               |

## 🔹 Novi kriteriji z delovnimi primeri

---

### 1. **Ton**
**Opredelitev**: Čustveni ali stilistični odnos odgovora (npr. formalen, sproščen, humoren, sočuten).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Napišite odgovor na pritožbo stranke s sočutnim in profesionalnim tonom.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Resnično nam je žal, da smo slišali za vašo nedavno izkušnjo. Vaše povratne informacije so za nas pomembne in sprejemamo ukrepe, da se to ne bo več ponovilo."

---

### 2. **Ciljna skupina**
**Opredelitev**: Predvideni bralec ali uporabnik vsebine (npr. otrok, najstnik, strokovnjak, izvršni direktor).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Razloži kvantno fiziko dvanajstletnemu otroku.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Si predstavljate majhne delce, ki so lahko na dveh mestih hkrati, kot čarobni kovanec, ki istočasno pristane na grbu in na številki?"

---

### 3. **Dolžina**
**Opredelitev**: Želena dolžina izhoda, kot je število besed, število odstavkov ali število stavkov.

**Primer opisa**:
```
Povzemite vsebino Romea in Julije v treh stavkih.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Romeo in Julija sta mlada ljubimca iz sovražnih družin v Veroni. Kljub sovraštvu njunih družin se skrivno poročita. Tragična vrsta nesporazumov ju privede do tega, da si vzameta življenje."

---

### 4. **Perspektiva**
**Opredelitev**: Pripovedni vidik (npr. prva oseba, tretja oseba, vsevedni, specifičen za lik).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Povej zgodbo o treh prašičkih z vidika volka.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Nisem hotel pihati in razpihati njihovih hiš. Le skodelico sladkorja sem si želel izposoditi!"

---

### 5. **Kulturna vsebina**
**Opredelitev**: Kulturna ali regionalna perspektiva, skozi katero naj se vsebina interpretira ali ustvari.

**Primer opisa**:
```
Prepišite pravljico Pepelka v japonski kulturi.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "V mirni vasici v starem Japonskem je živela prijazna deklica Aiko, ki je živela s svojo mačeho in polsestrami. Vsak dan je čistila hišo in skrbela za vrt. Na noč festivala češnjevih cvetov je s pomočjo čarobnega lisjaka obiskala cesarski ples."

---

### 6. **Nadzor pristranskosti**
**Opredelitev**: Napotek, da se izognete ali poudarite določene pristranskosti (npr. spol, kultura, politika).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Napišite opis delovnega mesta gasilca brez spolne pristranskosti.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Iščemo predanega posameznika, da se pridruži našemu gasilskemu oddelku. Idealni kandidat mora biti telesno pripravljen, sočuten in zmožen delati pod pritiskom."

---

### 7. **Specifičnost domene**
**Opredelitev**: Raven tehničnega ali specifičnega jezika domene (npr. laik, akademski, medicinski, pravni).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Razložite funkcijo mitohondrijev v laikih.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Mitohondriji so kot majhne elektrarne v vaših celicah. Pomagajo spremeniti hrano, ki jo jeste, v energijo, ki jo vaše telo lahko uporabi."

---

### 8. **Časovni kontekst**
**Opredelitev**: Časovno obdobje ali era, v katerem naj bo vsebina oblikovana (npr. preteklost, prihodnost, alternativna zgodovina).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Opisujte tipičen dan osebe, ki živi v letu 2400.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "V letu 2400 se zbudim ob sončnem vzhodu, ki ga simulirajo pametna okna. Po zajtrku, sintetiziranem iz alg, se s kvantno tablico teleportiram na delo in ves dan oblikujem protokole etike umetne inteligence za planetarno upravljanje."

---

### 9. **Razpoloženje**
**Opredelitev**: Čustvena atmosfera vsebine (npr. veselo, zlovešče, nostalgično).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Napišite kratko zgodbo, ki se odvija v gozdu z nostalgičnim razpoloženjem.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> "Gozd je bil tih, tako kot je bil, ko sem bil otrok. Zlati listi so plesali v vetru, vonj po boru pa mi je prinesel spomine na pozabljene poletne dni."

---

### 10. **Modalnost**
**Opredelitev**: Format ali senzorični tip izhoda (npr. besedilo, opis slike, avdio scenarij, video zgodba).

**Primer opisa**:
```
Ustvarite scenarij za 30-sekundni avdio oglas za novo blagovno znamko kave.
```

**Pričakovan izhod**:
> [Zvok mletja kave, vesela glasba]  
> Pripovedovalec: „Zbudite se z bogatim okusom Sunrise Roast. Gladka, bogata in pripravljena, ko ste vi. Na voljo zdaj pri vašem lokalnem trgovcu."

To copy a file in Python, the most common and straightforward method is to use the `shutil` module, which provides a high-level interface for file operations. The `shutil.copy()` function is used to copy files from a source to a destination.

### Example 1: Using `shutil.copy()`

```python
import shutil

# Source and destination file paths
src = 'source.txt'
dst = 'destination.txt'

# Copy file
shutil.copy(src, dst)

print("File copied successfully.")
```

**Output:**
```
File copied successfully.
```

This will copy the contents of `source.txt` to `destination.txt`, preserving the file’s permissions. If the destination file already exists, it will be replaced.

---

### Example 2: Using `shutil.copy2()`

If you also want to preserve metadata (like file modification times), you can use `shutil.copy2()`.

```python
import shutil

src = 'source.txt'
dst = 'destination2.txt'

shutil.copy2(src, dst)

print("File copied with metadata.")
```

**Output:**
```
File copied with metadata.
```

This function copies the file and also attempts to preserve all metadata associated with the file.

---

### Example 3: Manual Copy Using `open()` (Not Recommended for General Use)

You can also manually read and write files using built-in `open()` functions.

```python
with open('source.txt', 'rb') as src_file:
    with open('destination3.txt', 'wb') as dst_file:
        dst_file.write(src_file.read())

print("File copied manually.")
```

**Output:**
```
File copied manually.
```

This method is useful if you need to process the file contents during the copy, but for most use cases, `shutil` is preferred for simplicity and reliability.

---

Make sure the source file exists before attempting to copy, or handle exceptions using `try-except` blocks for robustness.

Za kopiranje datoteke v Pythonu je najpogostejši in najpreprostejši način uporaba modula `shutil`, ki ponuja vmesnik na visoki ravni za operacije z datotekami. Funkcija `shutil.copy()` se uporablja za kopiranje datotek iz izvornega pota v ciljni pot.

### Primer 1: uporaba `shutil.copy()`

```python
import shutil

# Pot izvorne in ciljne datoteke
src = 'source.txt'
dst = 'destination.txt'

# Kopiranje datoteke
shutil.copy(src, dst)

print("Datoteka je uspešno kopirana.")
```

**Izhod:**
```
Datoteka je uspešno kopirana.
```

To bo kopiralo vsebino `source.txt` v `destination.txt` in ohranilo dovoljenja datoteke. Če ciljna datoteka že obstaja, bo nadomeščena.

---

### Primer 2: uporaba `shutil.copy2()`

Če želite prav tako ohraniti metapodatke (kot so datumi spremembe datoteke), lahko uporabite `shutil.copy2()`.

```python
import shutil

src = 'source.txt'
dst = 'destination2.txt'

shutil.copy2(src, dst)

print("Datoteka je kopirana z metapodatki.")
```

**Izhod:**
```
Datoteka je kopirana z metapodatki.
```

Ta funkcija kopira datoteko in poskuša ohraniti vse metapodatke, ki so povezani z datoteko.

---

### Primer 3: ročno kopiranje z uporabo `open()` (NI PRIPOROČLJIVO ZA SPLOŠNO UPORABO)

Datoteko lahko ročno preberete in zapišete tudi z uporabo vgrajenih funkcij `open()`.

```python
with open('source.txt', 'rb') as src_file:
    with open('destination3.txt', 'wb') as dst_file:
        dst_file.write(src_file.read())

print("Datoteka je kopirana ročno.")
```

**Izhod:**
```
Datoteka je kopirana ročno.
```

Ta metoda je uporabna, če morate med kopiranjem datoteke obdelati njeno vsebino, vendar je za večino primerov boljša uporaba modula `shutil` zaradi preprostosti in zanesljivosti.

---

Pred poskusom kopiranja se prepričajte, da izvorna datoteka obstaja, ali pa za robustnost uporabite bloke `try-except`.

Here's a detailed plan for a **web application** that allows users to **browse old-time radio series and episodes**, and **play MP3 audio files**. This app will be built using modern web development practices and will include a frontend, backend, and database design.

---

## 🎙️ Project Name: **OldTimeRadioPlayer**

---

## 🧩 1. Features Overview

- **Browse Series**: List of old-time radio series with metadata (title, description, era, genre, etc.).
- **Browse Episodes**: List of episodes per series with titles, air dates, descriptions.
- **Play MP3 Audio**: In-browser audio player for each episode.
- **Search Functionality**: Search by series title, episode title, or genre.
- **User Authentication (Optional)**: For favorites, playlists, or history.
- **Responsive Design**: Works on desktop and mobile.

---

## 🧱 2. Tech Stack

### 🔧 Backend
- **Python** with **Flask** or **Django** (Django is better for ORM and admin panel).
- **Database**: SQLite (for development), PostgreSQL (for production).
- **REST API**: For communication between frontend and backend.

### 🌐 Frontend
- **React.js** (or Vue.js) for dynamic UI.
- **HTML5 Audio Player** for MP3 playback.
- **Tailwind CSS** or **Bootstrap** for styling.

### 📁 Audio Storage
- MP3 files stored in a directory or cloud (e.g., AWS S3 or local server path).
- Metadata stored in the database.

---

## 🗃️ 3. Data Model (Database Schema)

### Series
| Field         | Type         | Description                     |
|---------------|--------------|---------------------------------|
| id            | Integer      | Primary Key                     |
| title         | String       | Series title                    |
| description   | Text         | Description of the series       |
| start_year    | Integer      | Year series started             |
| end_year      | Integer      | Year series ended               |
| genre         | String       | e.g., Drama, Comedy, Sci-Fi     |
| image_url     | String       | Optional poster/image URL       |

### Episode
| Field         | Type         | Description                     |
|---------------|--------------|---------------------------------|
| id            | Integer      | Primary Key                     |
| series_id     | Integer      | Foreign Key to Series           |
| title         | String       | Episode title                   |
| air_date      | Date         | Original air date               |
| description   | Text         | Episode description             |
| audio_url     | String       | Path/URL to MP3 file            |
| duration      | String       | e.g., "30:00"                   |

---

## 🌐 4. API Endpoints (Backend)

| Endpoint              | Method | Description                           |
|-----------------------|--------|----------------------------------------|
| `/api/series`         | GET    | List all series                        |
| `/api/series/<id>`    | GET    | Get a specific series                  |
| `/api/series/<id>/episodes` | GET | Get episodes of a series       |
| `/api/episodes/<id>`  | GET    | Get a specific episode                 |
| `/api/episodes/search`| POST   | Search episodes by title or series     |

---

## 🖥️ 5. Frontend Pages

### Home Page
- Featured series.
- Search bar.
- Browse by genre/year.

### Series Page
- Series title, image, description.
- List of episodes.
- Play episodes.

### Episode Page
- Episode title, air date, description.
- Audio player to play MP3.

### Search Results Page
- Display matching episodes/series.

---

## 🎵 6. Audio Player

- Use HTML5 `<audio>` tag:
```html
<audio controls>
  <source src={episode.audio_url} type="audio/mpeg" />
  Your browser does not support the audio element.
</audio>
```
- Optional: Use a React audio player library (e.g., `react-h5-audio-player`).

---

## 📁 7. Folder Structure (Example)

```
old-time-radio-app/
├── backend/
│   ├── app.py
│   ├── models.py
│   ├── database.py
│   └── static/audio/ (MP3 files)
├── frontend/

│   ├── src/

│   │   │   ├── SeriesList.js
│   │   │   ├── EpisodeList.js
│   │   │   ├── AudioPlayer.js
│   │   ├── App.js
│   │   └── index.js
│   └── package.json
└── README.md
```

---

## 🧪 8. Development Steps

### Phase 1: Backend
1. Set up Flask/Django project.
2. Define models for Series and Episode.
3. Create API endpoints.
4. Seed database with sample data.
5. Serve MP3 files via static directory or external storage.

### Phase 2: Frontend
1. Create React app.
2. Build UI components for browsing and playing.
3. Connect to backend API.
4. Implement audio player.

### Phase 3: Polish & Deploy
1. Add search functionality.
2. Add responsive design.
3. Deploy backend and frontend (e.g., using Heroku, Vercel, or AWS).
4. (Optional) Add user authentication and favorites.

Aplikacija bo zgrajena z uporabo sodobnih praks razvoja spletnih strani in bo vključevala oblikovanje prednjega in zadnjega dela ter podatkovne baze.

## 🎙️ Ime projekta: **OldTimeRadioPlayer**

## 🧩 1. Pregled funkcij

- **Pregledovanje serij**: seznam starih radijskih serij s podatki (naslov, opis, obdobje, žanr itd.).
- **Pregledovanje epizod**: seznam epizod po serijah z naslovi, datumi predvajanja in opisi.
- **Predvajanje MP3-jev**: predvajalnik zvoka v brskalniku za vsako epizodo.
- **Iskanje po funkcionalnosti**: iskanje po naslovu serije, naslovu epizode ali žanru.
- **Uporabniška prijava (neobvezno)**: za priljubljene, predvajalne sezname ali zgodovino.
- **Odziven dizajn**: deluje na namiznih in mobilnih napravah.

- **Podatkovna baza**: SQLite (za razvoj), PostgreSQL (za produkcijo).
- **REST API**: za komunikacijo med sprednjim in zalednim delom.

### 🌐 Sprednji del
- **React.js** (ali Vue.js) za dinamičen uporabniški vmesnik.
- **HTML5 predvajalnik zvoka** za predvajanje MP3.
- **Tailwind CSS** ali **Bootstrap** za oblikovanje.

### 📁 Shranjevanje zvoka
- MP3-ji so shranjeni v imeniku ali oblaku (npr. AWS S3 ali lokalni strežnik).
- Podatki so shranjeni v podatkovni bazi.

**Abstract**

The orchestration of complex IT systems has become a critical capability in modern enterprise environments, where heterogeneous infrastructure, distributed applications, and dynamic workloads demand seamless coordination and automation. This paper explores the principles, challenges, and best practices in orchestrating complex IT systems, focusing on the integration of cloud-native technologies, containerization, and workflow automation tools. We examine how orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes, Ansible, and service meshes enable efficient management of microservices, resource allocation, service discovery, and fault tolerance. Furthermore, we discuss the role of policy-driven automation, monitoring, and self-healing mechanisms in ensuring system reliability and scalability. Through case studies and real-world examples, this work highlights the strategic importance of orchestration in achieving agility, operational efficiency, and resilience in today’s rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Sure! Below is a Python program that takes **time series sales data** and extracts **key variables** that are useful for forecasting, analysis, or modeling (e.g., for machine learning or statistical forecasting models like ARIMA, Prophet, or XGBoost).

---

### ✅ Key Variables Extracted:
- **Lagged features** (e.g., sales from previous days)
- **Rolling mean / moving average**
- **Day of week, month, year**
- **Is_weekend** flag
- **Time trend** (days since start)
- **Sales difference** (change in sales)
- **Seasonal lags** (e.g., sales from same day last week/month)

---

## 📦 Requirements

Install required packages if you don't already have them:

```bash
pip install pandas numpy matplotlib
```

---

## 🧠 Python Program

```python
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

def extract_key_variables(df, date_col='date', sales_col='sales', lag_days=[1, 7, 30], window=7, seasonal_lag=7):
    """
    Takes a time series sales DataFrame and extracts key features.
    
    Args:
        df (pd.DataFrame): Input DataFrame with at least date and sales columns
        date_col (str): Name of the date column
        sales_col (str): Name of the sales column
        lag_days (list): List of lag days to create (e.g., [1, 7, 30])
        window (int): Window size for rolling mean and std
        seasonal_lag (int): Lag for seasonal comparison (e.g., 7 for weekly seasonality)

    Returns:
        pd.DataFrame: DataFrame with extracted features
    """
    # Make a copy
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Convert date column to datetime
    df[date_col] = pd.to_datetime(df[date_col])
    df = df.sort_values(date_col).reset_index(drop=True)

    # Set date column as index for easier time series operations
    df.set_index(date_col, inplace=True)

    # Extract date-related features
    df['day_of_week'] = df.index.dayofweek
    df['day_of_month'] = df.index.day
    df['month'] = df.index.month
    df['year'] = df.index.year
    df['is_weekend'] = df.index.weekday >= 5  # 5 = Saturday, 6 = Sunday

    # Time trend (days since start)
    df['time_trend'] = np.arange(len(df))

    # Lag features
    for lag in lag_days:
        df[f'sales_lag_{lag}'] = df[sales_col].shift(lag)

    # Rolling mean and std
    df[f'sales_rolling_mean_{window}'] = df[sales_col].rolling(window=window).mean()
    df[f'sales_rolling_std_{window}'] = df[sales_col].rolling(window=window).std()

    # Sales difference (daily change)
    df['sales_diff_1'] = df[sales_col].diff(1)

    # Seasonal lag (e.g., same day last week)
    df[f'sales_seasonal_lag_{seasonal_lag}'] = df[sales_col].shift(seasonal_lag)

    # Reset index to bring date back as a column
    df.reset_index(inplace=True)

    return df

# Example usage
if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Sample data
    data = {
        'date': pd.date_range(start='2024-01-01', periods=100, freq='D'),
        'sales': np.random.randint(50, 200, size=100)
    }
    df = pd.DataFrame(data)

    # Extract features
    df_features = extract_key_variables(df, date_col='date', sales_col='sales')

    print(df_features.head(10))
```

---

## 📊 Output Example

| date       | sales | day_of_week | is_weekend | time_trend | sales_lag_1 | sales_lag_7 | sales_rolling_mean_7 | sales_diff_1 | sales_seasonal_lag_7 |
|------------|-------|-------------|------------|------------|-------------|-------------|-----------------------|--------------|-----------------------|
| 2024-01-01 | 123   | 0           | False      | 0          | NaN         | NaN         | NaN                   | NaN          | NaN                   |
| 2024-01-02 | 150   | 1           | False      | 1          | 123         | NaN         | NaN                   | 27.0         | NaN                   |
| ...        | ...   | ...         | ...        | ...        | ...         | ...         | ...                   | ...          | ...                   |

---

## 🛠️ Notes

- You can customize the lags and rolling window based on the **seasonality** of your data (daily, weekly, monthly).
- Handle missing values (`NaN`) introduced by lags and rolling features before modeling.
- This can be extended with **holiday flags**, **external regressors**, or **Fourier terms** for complex seasonality.

- **Razlika v prodaji** (sprememba prodaje)
- **Sezonski zamiki** (npr. prodaja na isti dan prejšnjega tedna/meseca)

## 🧠 Pythonov program

```python
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

def extract_key_variables(df, date_col='date', sales_col='sales', lag_days=[1, 7, 30], window=7, seasonal_lag=7):
    """
    Vzame časovno vrsto prodajnega DataFrame in izvleče ključne značilnosti.
    
    Args:
        df (pd.DataFrame): Vhodni DataFrame z vsaj stolpcema datum in prodaja
        date_col (str): Ime stolpca za datum
        sales_col (str): Ime stolpca za prodajo
        lag_days (list): Seznam dni zamika za ustvarjanje (npr. [1, 7, 30])
        window (int): Velikost okna za drsno povprečje in standardni odklon
        seasonal_lag (int): Zamik za sezonsko primerjavo (npr. 7 za tedensko sezonskost)

    Returns:
        pd.DataFrame: DataFrame z izvlečeno značilnostjo
    """
    # Naredite kopijo
    df = df.copy()
    
    # Pretvorite stolpec datum v datetime
    df[date_col] = pd.to_datetime(df[date_col])
    df = df.sort_values(date_col).reset_index(drop=True)

    # Nastavite stolpec datum za indeks za lažje časovne operacije z vrstami
    df.set_index(date_col, inplace=True)

    # Izvlecite značilnosti, povezane z datumom
    df['day_of_week'] = df.index.dayofweek
    df['day_of_month'] = df.index.day
    df['month'] = df.index.month
    df['year'] = df.index.year
    df['is_weekend'] = df.index.weekday >= 5  # 5 = sobota, 6 = nedelja

    # Časovni trend (številka dni od začetka)
    df['time_trend'] = np.arange(len(df))

    # Zamikane funkcije
    for lag in lag_days:
        df[f'sales_lag_{lag}'] = df[sales_col].shift(lag)

    # Drsno povprečje in standardni odklon
    df[f'sales_rolling_mean_{window}'] = df[sales_col].rolling(window=window).mean()
    df[f'sales_rolling_std_{window}'] = df[sales_col].rolling(window=window).std()

    # Razlika v prodaji (dnevna sprememba)
    df['sales_diff_1'] = df[sales_col].diff(1)

    # Sezonski zamik (npr. isti dan prejšnjega tedna)
    df[f'sales_seasonal_lag_{seasonal_lag}'] = df[sales_col].shift(seasonal_lag)

    # Ponastavitev indeksa, da se datum vrne kot stolpec
    df.reset_index(inplace=True)

    return df

# Primer uporabe
if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Vzorčni podatki
    data = {
        'date': pd.date_range(start='2024-01-01', periods=100, freq='D'),
        'sales': np.random.randint(50, 200, size=100)
    }
    df = pd.DataFrame(data)

    # Izvlecite značilnosti
    df_features = extract_key_variables(df, date_col='date', sales_col='sales')

    print(df_features.head(10))
```

**Few-shot knowledge graph completion (FKGC)** is a subfield of knowledge graph (KG) research that focuses on predicting missing facts (e.g., relations between entities) in a knowledge graph using only a **limited number of training examples** per relation.

---

### 🔍 Background: Knowledge Graph Completion (KGC)

In general, **knowledge graph completion** involves predicting missing links (i.e., triples of the form (head entity, relation, tail entity)) in a knowledge graph using machine learning models trained on the existing triples.

Traditional KGC methods require **many examples per relation** to learn effective representations. However, real-world knowledge graphs often have **rare or newly added relations** with only a few known facts.

---

### 📸 What is Few-shot KGC?

**Few-shot KGC** addresses the challenge of predicting relations when only a **small number of examples (e.g., 1 to 10)** are available for a particular relation. It is inspired by **few-shot learning**, a paradigm in machine learning where models learn to generalize from limited data.

- **Goal**: Learn to predict new facts for relations that have only a few observed examples.
- **Motivation**: Real-world KGs are often **long-tailed**, meaning most relations appear only a few times.
- **Key Challenge**: Generalizing from limited examples, possibly by leveraging **transfer learning**, **meta-learning**, or **relation similarity**.

---

### 🧠 Key Techniques in Few-shot KGC

1. **Meta-learning**:
   - Train models to quickly adapt to new relations with few examples.
   - E.g., MAML (Model-Agnostic Meta-Learning) applied to KGC.

2. **Relation Prototypes**:
   - Learn a prototype (e.g., average embedding) for each relation from its few examples.
   - Use similarity measures (e.g., cosine similarity) to predict new facts.

3. **Metric Learning**:
   - Learn a distance metric in the embedding space that can generalize to unseen relations.

4. **Pre-training and Transfer Learning**:
   - Use pre-trained language models or KG embeddings to initialize models.
   - Transfer knowledge from frequent relations to rare ones.

5. **Graph Neural Networks (GNNs)**:
   - Use GNNs to propagate information from neighbors, even when only a few direct examples exist.

---

### 📚 Example

Suppose you have a knowledge graph with entities like `Barack Obama`, `Michelle Obama`, and `United States`.

You have only **two examples** of the relation `spouse`:
- (`Barack Obama`, `spouse`, `Michelle Obama`)
- (`Prince William`, `spouse`, `Kate Middleton`)

A **few-shot KGC model** would use these two examples to infer other plausible `spouse` relationships, such as:
- (`Elton John`, `spouse`, `David Furnish`)

---

### 🏆 Benchmark Datasets

- **FewRel**: Originally for few-shot relation classification, adapted for KGC.
- **WikiFewShot**: A benchmark specifically designed for few-shot KGC.
- **NELL-FewShot**: Based on the NELL knowledge base.

---

### 🧪 Evaluation Metrics

- **Hits@K**: Proportion of correct entities ranked in the top K.
- **Mean Reciprocal Rank (MRR)**: Average of reciprocal ranks of correct entities.

---

### 🚀 Applications

- Adding new relations to a knowledge graph with minimal supervision.
- Enhancing knowledge graphs in domains with scarce data (e.g., medical, legal).
- Improving downstream NLP tasks like question answering and recommendation systems.

---

### 📚 Summary

| Aspect | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| **Definition** | Predicting missing links for relations with few known examples |
| **Goal** | Generalize from limited data to unseen relations |
| **Techniques** | Meta-learning, prototypes, metric learning, GNNs |
| **Challenge** | Lack of training data per relation |
| **Use Cases** | Long-tailed KGs, new relation addition, low-resource domains |

---

**Dokončanje znanja z malo posnetki (FKGC)** je področje raziskav na področju znanja (KG), ki se osredotoča na napovedovanje manjkajočih dejstev (npr. odnosov med subjekti) v znanju grafa s pomočjo **omejenega števila primerov usposabljanja na razmerje**.

---

### 🔍 Zgodovina: dokončanje grafa znanja (KGC)

Na splošno **dokončanje grafa znanja** vključuje napovedovanje manjkajočih povezav (torej trojice v obliki (glava subjekta, razmerja, rep subjekta)) v znanju grafa z uporabo strojnega učenja modelov, ki so bili trenirani na obstoječih trojčkih.

Tradicionalne metode KGC zahtevajo **številne primere na razmerje**, da se učinkovito naučijo predstavitev. Vendar pa imajo dejanski znanjski grafi pogosto **redki ali na novo dodani odnosi**, za katere je znano le nekaj dejstev.

---

### 📸 Kaj je dokončanje znanja z malo posnetki?

**Dokončanje znanja z malo posnetki** naslavlja izziv napovedovanja odnosov, ko je na voljo **zgolj majhno število primerov (npr. od 1 do 10)**. Navdih črpa iz **učenja z malo posnetki**, paradigme strojnega učenja, kjer se modeli učijo posploševati iz omejene količine podatkov.

- **Cilj**: Naučiti se napovedovati nova dejstva za odnose, ki imajo le nekaj opaženih primerov.
- **Motivacija**: Dejanski znanjski grami so pogosto **dolgi rep**, kar pomeni, da se večina odnosov pojavi le nekajkrat.
- **Glavni izziv**: Posploševanje iz omejenega števila primerov, morda z uporabo **prenosnega učenja**, **meta-učenja** ali **podobnosti med odnosi**.

---

### 🧠 Glavne tehnike dokončanja znanja z malo posnetki

1. **Meta-učenje**:
   - Treniranje modelov, da se hitro prilagodijo na nove odnose z malo primerov.
   - Npr. uporaba MAML (Meta-learning without Learning to Learn) za KGC.

2. **Prototipi odnosov**:
   - Učenje prototipa (npr. povprečnega vstavljanja) za vsak odnos iz nekaj primerov.
   - Uporaba mer podobnosti (npr. kosinusna podobnost) za napovedovanje novih dejstev.

3. **Učenje metrične funkcije**:
   - Učenje metrične funkcije v vstavitvenem prostoru, ki lahko posploši na nevidne odnose.

4. **Predhodno učenje in prenosno učenje**:
   - Uporaba predhodno naučenih jezikovnih modelov ali znanja grafa za inicializacijo modelov.
   - Prenos znanja iz pogosto pojavljenih odnosov na redke.

5. **Grafična nevronska omrežja (GNN)**:
   - Uporaba GNN za širjenje informacij iz bližnjih vozlišč, tudi če obstaja le nekaj neposrednih primerov.

---

### 📚 Primer

Predstavljajte si znanjski graf z subjekti, kot so "Barack Obama", "Michelle Obama" in "Združene države".

Imate **dva primera odnosa** "partner":
- ("Barack Obama", "partner", "Michelle Obama")
- (Princ William", "partner", "Kate Middleton")

Model dokončanja znanja z malo posnetki bi iz teh dveh primerov sklepali o drugih verjetnih partnerskih razmerjih, kot je:
- ("Elton John", "partner", "David Furnish")

---

### 🏆 Referenčni podatkovni zbirki

- **FewRel**: Prvotno za učenje klasifikacije razmerja z malo posnetki, prilagojen za KGC.
- **WikiFewShot**: Referenčni podatkovni zbirki, ki je specifično zasnovan za dokončanje znanja z malo posnetki.
- **NELL-FewShot**: Glede na znanjsko bazo NELL.

---

### 🧪 Metrike za ocenjevanje

- **Udarci@K**: Delež pravilno uvrščenih subjektov med najboljših K.
- **Povprečna obratna stopnja (MRR)**: Povprečje recipročnih stopenj pravilnih subjektov.

---

### 🚀 Uporaba

- Dodajanje novih odnosov v znanjski graf z minimalnim nadzorom.
- Izboljšanje znanjskih grafov v domenah, ki jih je težko opisati (npr. medicinska, pravna).
- Izboljšanje odzivnosti NLP nalog, kot je iskanje odgovorov in priporočanje.

---

### 📚 Povzetek

| Vidik | Opis |
|-------|-------------|
| **Definicija** | Napovedovanje manjkajočih povezav za odnose z redkimi znanimi primeri |
| **Cilj** | Posploševanje na podlagi omejenih podatkov na nevidne odnose|
| **Tehnike** | Meta-učenje, prototipi, učenje metrične funkcije, GNN |
| **Izziv** | Pomanjkanje podatkov za usposabljanje na odnos |
| **Uporabni primeri** | Dolgi rep, dodajanje novih odnosov, domene z omejenimi podatki |

---

**Title: The Weight of a Lie**

In the quiet town of Maplewood, nestled between rolling hills and autumn-kissed trees, the Carter family seemed to live the kind of life others envied. David and Emily Carter were both respected in the community—David as a local mechanic with a booming shop, Emily as a schoolteacher beloved by her students. Their two children, 16-year-old Jacob and 12-year-old Lily, were bright and well-mannered. But behind the white picket fence and the perfect smiles, a secret festered.

It began with a financial crunch. David’s shop had a rough year, and Emily’s salary wasn’t enough to cover the mortgage, private school tuition, and the growing medical bills for Lily, who had been diagnosed with a rare developmental disorder. Or so the town believed.

In truth, Lily had no such condition.

The diagnosis had been fabricated.

It started with a lie told to a school counselor during a parent-teacher conference. Emily, overwhelmed and desperate for some relief, had exaggerated Lily’s difficulties in school. The counselor, concerned, referred them to a specialist. Desperation turned into opportunity when the specialist, unfamiliar with Lily’s full history, recommended a formal evaluation.

The Carters leaned into the mistake. They hired a private evaluator, someone who asked few questions and provided a detailed report confirming a developmental disability that required special education services, therapy, and financial support.

Soon, the benefits rolled in—government assistance, tax breaks, school accommodations, and a monthly disability stipend. It was a lifeline. The pressure eased. The mortgage was paid. The kids stayed in their private schools. Life looked better.

But the lie began to grow teeth.

Lily, unaware of the deception, started to believe she was different. Teachers treated her with kid gloves. Classmates whispered. She was pulled out of class for “therapy” sessions she didn’t need. Over time, she began to internalize the label. Her confidence wavered. She stopped trying in school, convinced she wasn’t “smart enough.”

Jacob, meanwhile, started to notice the cracks. He overheard his parents arguing late one night. Emily was worried the school would dig deeper. David insisted they were in too deep to stop now.

“You think we can just undo this?” David snapped. “We’d lose everything.”

Jacob confronted his mother the next morning. Emily, tearful and guilt-ridden, confessed everything.

The guilt crushed him. He felt complicit by silence. He watched his sister struggle with an identity that wasn’t real. He watched his parents lie to doctors, teachers, and even family.

One day, Lily came home from school in tears. A classmate had discovered her file and spread the rumor that she was “faking it.” The shame was unbearable. She locked herself in her room and refused to speak to anyone.

That night, Jacob made a choice. He told his parents he was going to the school board. Emily begged him not to. David threatened to kick him out.

But Jacob didn’t back down.

The truth came out in a quiet, devastating meeting with the principal and a social worker. The Carters were investigated. The disability benefits were revoked. David’s shop suffered as the town turned its back on them. Emily was suspended from teaching pending review.

The Carters lost much of what they had. But in the wreckage, something changed.

Emily sat Lily down and told her the truth. It was painful, but freeing. Lily was furious at first, but with time, she began to rebuild her confidence. Therapy, this time real therapy, helped her process the damage.

Jacob, though scarred by the experience, became an advocate for honesty and accountability in his high school. He gave a powerful speech at graduation about the cost of lies and the courage it takes to do the right thing.

The Carters never regained their former status, but they found something more valuable: each other, and the chance to start over with truth as their foundation.

Because in the end, the weight of a lie is always heavier than the burden of the truth.

**Naslov: Teža laži**

V mirnem mestu Maplewood, ki leži med valovitimi griči in drevesi, ki jih je pozdravila jesen, je družina Carter živela življenje, ki so mu drugi zavidali. David in Emily Carter sta bila v skupnosti spoštovana – David kot lokalni mehanik z uspešnim podjetjem, Emily pa kot učiteljica, ki so jo ljubili njeni učenci. Njuna dva otroka, 16-letni Jacob in 12-letna Lily, sta bila bistra in dobro vzgojena. Toda za belo ograjo in popolnimi nasmehi se je skrivala skrivnost.

Začelo se je s finančnimi težavami. Davidovemu podjetju ni šlo dobro in Emilyjina plača ni bila dovolj za hipoteko, šolnino za zasebno šolo in vedno večje zdravstvene stroške za Lily, ki je bila diagnosticirana z redko razvojno motnjo. Ali vsaj tako so verjeli v mestu.

V resnici Lily ni imela nobene take bolezni.

Diagnoza je bila izmišljena.

Začelo se je z lažjo, ki jo je povedala šolski svetovalki med starševskim sestankom. Emily, preobremenjena in obupana, je pretiravala glede Lilyjinih težav v šoli. Svetovalka, zaskrbljena, ju je napotila k specialistu. Ko je specialist, ne da bi poznal Lilyjino celotno zgodovino, priporočil uradno oceno, se je obup spremenil v priložnost.

Carterjeva sta se z lažjo sprijaznila. Najela sta zasebnega ocenjevalca, nekoga, ki ni postavil veliko vprašanj in je podal podrobno poročilo, v katerem je potrdil razvojno motnjo, ki je zahtevala posebno izobraževanje, terapijo in finančno podporo.

Kmalu so se začele vrstiti koristi – vladna pomoč, davčne olajšave, šolske ugodnosti in mesečna invalidnina. To je bil rešilni pas. Pritisk se je sprostil. Hipoteka je bila poplačana. Otroka sta ostala v zasebnih šolah. Življenje je izgledalo bolje.

Vendar je laž začela rasti.

Lily, ki ni bila seznanjena z zvijačo, je začela verjeti, da je drugačna. Učitelji so se do nje vedli kot do otroka v rokavicah. Sošolci so šepetali. Iz razreda so jo vlekli na "terapevtske" seanse, ki jih ni potrebovala. Sčasoma je začela ponotranjiti etiketo. Njeno samozaupanje se je zamajalo. V šoli ni več poskušala, saj je bila prepričana, da ni "dovolj pametna".

Jacob je medtem začel opažati razpoke. Nekega večera je pozno zvečer slišal starša, ki sta se prepirala. Emily je bila zaskrbljena, da bo šola šla globlje. David je vztrajal, da so zdaj pregloboko, da bi lahko nehali.

"Ali misliš, da lahko to razveljavimo?" je David zarohnel. "Izgubili bomo vse."

Jacob je naslednje jutro soočil mamo. Emily je bila polna solza in občutkov krivde, ko je priznala vse.

Občutek krivde ga je zlomil. Čutil se je soodgovornega zaradi molka. Opazoval je, kako se njegova sestra bori z identiteto, ki ni resnična. Opazoval je, kako njuni starši lažejo zdravnikom, učiteljem in celo družini.

Nekega dne je Lily prišla domov v solzah. Nek sošolec je odkril njeno kartoteko in razširil govorico, da "si izmišljuje". Sramota je bila neznosna. Zaprla se je v svojo sobo in se ni hotela pogovarjati z nikomer.

Tistega večera je Jacob sprejel odločitev. Staršem je povedal, da bo obiskal šolsko komisijo. Emily ga je prosila, naj tega ne stori. David mu je zagrozil, da ga bo vrgel iz hiše.

Vendar Jacob ni popustil.

Resnica je prišla na dan na tihem, uničujočem sestanku s ravnateljem in socialnim delavcem. Carterjevi so bili pod preiskavo. Invalidnina je bila preklicana. Davidovemu podjetju je šlo slabo, ko se je mesto obrnilo proti njim. Emily so odvzeli poučevanje, dokler niso pregledali zadeve.

Carterjevi so izgubili veliko tega, kar so imeli. Toda v razbitinah se je nekaj spremenilo.

Emily je Lily sedela in ji povedala resnico. Bilo je boleče, a osvobajajoče. Lily je bila najprej besna, vendar je sčasoma začela ponovno graditi svoje samozavest. Terapija, tokrat prava terapija, ji je pomagala, da je predelala škodo.

Jacob, čeprav je bil zaradi izkušnje zaznamovan, je postal zagovornik poštenosti in odgovornosti v svoji srednji šoli. Na podelitvi spričeval je imel močan govor o stroških laži in poguma, ki je potreben, da storiš pravo stvar.

Carterjevi niso nikoli obnovili svojega nekdanjega statusa, vendar so našli nekaj dragocenejšega: drug drugega in priložnost, da začnejo znova z resnico kot svojo podlago.

Ker je na koncu teža laži vedno težja od bremena resnice.
