Kupovanje poceni cigar je lahko odličen način za uživanje v izkušnji, ne da bi pri tem veliko zapravili, vendar je pomembno uravnotežiti strošek s kakovostjo. Naštevanje nekaterih lokacij in nasvetov za iskanje *cenejšnih cigar*:

---

### 📍 **Kje lahko kupite poceni cigarene znamke?**
#### 1. **Spletni prodajalci** (največkrat najboljše cene)
Te spletne strani pogosto ponujajo ugodnosti, pakete in različne popuste za strojno izdelane ali proračunsko prijazne ročno izdelane cigare:

- **Cigar.com**
- **Cigars International**
- **JR Cigar**
- **Corona Cigar Co.**
- **Atlantic Cigar Co.**

**Nasveti:**
- Poiščite rubrike kot so "cenejše cigare" ali "cigare z vrednostjo".
- Cigare kupujte v večjih količinah (pet, deset ali v paketih).
- Naročite se na novice za prejemanje kuponov ali obvestil o posebnih ponudbah.

#### 2. **Bencinske črpalke / trgovine na drobno**
V njih lahko najdete zelo poceni cigare, kot so:
- **Backwoods**
- **Swisher Sweets**
- **Dutch Masters**
- **White Owl**

**Opomba:** Te so strojno izdelane in pogosto imajo slajši ali aromatizirane različice. Ne veljajo za premijske, vendar so zelo dostopne.

#### 3. **Prodajalne cigaret / trgovine s tobačnimi izdelki**
Lokalne prodajalne cigaret pogosto prodajajo proračunsko prijazne cigare in včasih nudijo boljše dogovore kot velike trgovske verige. Morda boste našli tudi strokovno usposobljeno osebje, ki vam lahko pomaga pri izbiri.

#### 4. **Supermarketi / velike trgovine**
- Walmart
- Walgreens
- CVS (v nekaterih državah)

Nekatere od njih običajno ponujajo osnovne cigarene blagovne znamke, kot so Swisher Sweets, Backwoods ali Phillies.

#### 5. **Outlet prodajalne cigaretnih tovarn ali diskontne trgovine**
Nekateri proizvajalci cigar imajo outlete, s kakršnimiimi lahko dobite rahlo poškodovane cigare po nižji ceni.

---

### 🚬 **Popularni, proračunsko prijazni cigareni znamki**

| Vrsta | Blagovna znamka | Opombe |
|------|-------|-------|
| Strojno izdelane | Swisher Sweets | Sladki, aromatizirani, zelo dostopni |
| Strojno izdelane | Backwoods | Naravni, podeželski ovoj, priljubljeni |
| Strojno izdelane | White Owl | Gladki, klasični |
| Ročno izdelane (proračun) | Arturo Fuente Hemispheres | Izjemna vrednost za ročno izdelane cigare |
| Ročno izdelane (proračun) | La Flor Dominicana Ligero (cenejše velikosti) | Dominikanska aromatika |
| Ročno izdelane (proračun) | La Flor Dominicana Double Ligero Chisel (manjše velikosti) | Močne in okusne |
| Ročno izdelane (proračun) | Arturo Fuente Chateau Fuente | Dostopna pot do premijskih cigar |

---

### 📌 Nasveti za kupovanje poceni cigar

- **Izberite manjše velikosti**, kot so cigarilos ali petit coronas, ki lahko prihranijo nekaj denarja.
- **Preizkusite pakete** - mnoge spletne trgovine ponujajo 20-pakung blažjih ali srednje močnih cigar po manj kot 30 dolarjev.
- **Poiščite akcije**, zlasti med prazniki, kot sta dan Očetov ali 4. julij.
- **Izogibajte se preveč suhim cigaram** - tudi poceni cigare morajo biti rahlo čvrste in svežega vonja.
- **Preizkusite strojno izdelane cigare**, če je vaš proračun resnično omejen.

---

### 🚫 Čemu se izogibati
- Zelo suhim ali počenim cigarah.
- Cigarah neznanih znamk, brez ocen.
- Cigaram, ki so v paketu iz plastike (običajno izjemno nizke kvalitete).
- Cigarah, ki so tako poceni, da se zdijo neverjetne (še posebej spletno – pazite na goljufije).

Certainly. The Bible acknowledges the painful reality that friends may turn away or betray someone, especially those who follow Christ faithfully. Here are several relevant Bible quotes and passages that speak about friends turning away or the challenges of betrayal and loyalty:

---

### 1. **Proverbs 18:24 (NIV)**
> *"One who has unreliable friends soon comes to ruin, but there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother."`

**Context**: This verse contrasts unreliable friends with the ideal of true friendship—pointing out that while some friends will fail you, there is a deeper loyalty that should be sought (and ultimately found in God and Christ).

---

### 2. **Psalm 55:12–14 (NIV)**
> *"If an enemy were insulting me, I could endure it… But it is you, my equal, my companion, my close friend, with whom I once enjoyed sweet fellowship as we walked with the crowd in the house of God."`

**Context**: David expresses deep sorrow over betrayal by a close friend. This psalm is often seen as prophetic of Jesus’ experience with Judas (see John 13:18).

---

### 3. **John 13:18 (NIV)**
> *"I am not referring to all of you; I know those I have chosen. But this is to fulfill this passage of Scripture: 'He who shared my bread has turned against me.'"`

**Context**: Jesus speaks about Judas Iscariot, His friend and disciple, who would betray Him. This is a direct quote from **Psalm 41:9**, which Jesus applies to His own experience.

---

### 4. **Psalm 41:9 (NIV)**
> `"Even my close friend, whom I trusted, he who shared my bread, has turned against me."`

**Context**: Again, this is a prophetic passage that Jesus applies to His own betrayal by Judas. It reflects the deep pain of betrayal by someone close.

---

### 5. **2 Timothy 4:16 (NIV)**
> `"At my first defense, no one came to my support, but everyone deserted me. May it not be held against them."`

**Context**: The Apostle Paul writes about being abandoned by friends and fellow workers during his trial. This shows that even godly people may face desertion in times of hardship.

---

### 6. **Proverbs 17:17 (NIV)**
> `"A friend loves at all times, and a brother is born for a time of adversity."`

**Context**: While this is a positive statement about friendship, it implies that many who claim to be friends may not remain when adversity comes.

---

### 7. **Micah 7:5–7 (NIV)**
> `"Do not trust a neighbor; put no confidence in a friend. Even with her who lies in your embrace be careful with your words. For the son dishonors the father, the daughter rises up against the mother, the daughter-in-law against the mother-in-law—a man’s enemies are the members of his own household. But as for me, I watch in hope for the Lord, I wait for God my Savior; my God will hear me."`

**Context**: This passage speaks of a time of moral decay where even family and friends cannot be trusted. It reflects the kind of world Jesus would enter and the isolation He would face.

---

### 8. **Matthew 26:56 (NIV)**
> `"But this has all taken place that the writings of the prophets might be fulfilled." Then all the disciples left him and fled.`

**Context**: When Jesus was arrested, all His closest disciples (friends) fled in fear. This shows that even the most loyal can falter in times of crisis.

---

### Summary:
The Bible doesn't shy away from the reality that friends may turn away, betray, or abandon us—especially when we follow Christ. However, it also points to the ultimate Friend, Jesus, who never abandons us (John 15:13–15), and encourages believers to remain faithful even when others turn away.

Sure! The **Transformer** is a deep learning architecture introduced in the paper **"Attention Is All You Need"** (2017) by Vaswani et al. It revolutionized natural language processing (NLP) and became the foundation for large language models (LLMs) like BERT, GPT, and their successors.

Here's a breakdown of how the Transformer works, focusing on its core components and the overall architecture.

---

## 🧠 **High-Level Overview**

Traditional models like RNNs (Recurrent Neural Networks) process sequences one element at a time, which limits parallelization and speed. The **Transformer**, in contrast, **processes the entire sequence at once**, using a mechanism called **self-attention** to model relationships between words regardless of their distance in the sequence.

The Transformer consists of an **encoder-decoder structure**, but modern LLMs like GPT are **decoder-only**, while models like BERT are **encoder-only**.

---

## 🏗️ **Transformer Architecture**

### 1. **Input Embeddings**
- Words (or subwords) are converted into numerical **vectors** (embeddings) of fixed size (e.g., 512 or 768 dimensions).
- Each position in the sequence is also assigned a **positional encoding**, which gives the model information about the order of words since it doesn't process them sequentially.

---

### 2. **Self-Attention Mechanism**
This is the **core innovation** of the Transformer.

#### 🎯 What is Self-Attention?

Self-attention allows each word in a sequence to attend to **all other words**, calculating a weighted sum of the relationships between words.

#### 🧮 How It Works:

Each word is transformed into three vectors:
- **Query (Q)**: What am I looking for?
- **Key (K)**: What do I represent?
- **Value (V)**: What information do I provide?

The attention score for a word pair is calculated as:

$$
\text{Attention}(Q, K, V) = \text{softmax}\left(\frac{QK^T}{\sqrt{d_k}}\right)V
$$

Where:
- $ d_k $ is the dimension of the key vectors (scaling factor to stabilize gradients).

This gives a **contextualized representation** of each word based on its relationship with all other words in the sequence.

#### 🔄 Multi-Head Attention

- Multiple attention heads are used in parallel to capture **different types of relationships** (e.g., syntactic, semantic).
- The outputs of all heads are concatenated and linearly transformed.

---

### 3. **Position-wise Feed-Forward Networks**

After attention, each position is passed through a **feed-forward neural network** (typically two linear layers with a ReLU in between). This adds non-linearity and helps the model learn more complex patterns.

---

### 4. **Layer Normalization and Residual Connections**

Each sublayer (attention and feed-forward) is followed by:
- **Residual connection** (skip connection): Helps with gradient flow in deep networks.
- **Layer normalization**: Normalizes the inputs across feature dimensions.

---

### 5. **Encoder vs. Decoder**

#### 🧱 Encoder
- Input: Sequence of embeddings + positional encodings.
- Layers:
  - Multi-head self-attention.
  - Position-wise feed-forward network.
- Output: Contextualized representations of the input.

#### 🔍 Decoder
- Input: Target sequence shifted right (for autoregressive generation).
- Layers:
  - Masked multi-head self-attention (prevents attending to future tokens).
  - Encoder-decoder attention (uses encoder outputs as keys and values).
  - Position-wise feed-forward network.

---

## 🧠 Intuition Behind Transformers

- **Self-attention** lets the model dynamically focus on relevant parts of the input.
- **Multi-head attention** captures various aspects of meaning (e.g., subject-object relationships, negation).
- **Parallelization** makes Transformers much faster to train than RNNs.

---

## 🤖 In Large Language Models (LLMs)

- **GPT-style models** (e.g., GPT-3, GPT-4) use **decoder-only Transformers** to generate text autoregressively (one word at a time).
- **BERT-style models** use **encoder-only Transformers** to understand context bidirectionally (left and right context).
- Transformers are stacked into **many layers** (12 to over 100 in large models), enabling deep contextual understanding.

---

## 🧮 Example: How GPT Generates Text

1. Input: "The cat sat on the ___"
2. Embed each word and add positional encoding.
3. Pass through multiple decoder layers.
4. Each layer uses self-attention to understand the context.
5. Final output layer predicts the next word (e.g., "mat").

---

## 📈 Why Transformers Are Powerful

- **Contextual understanding**: Words are interpreted based on their context.
- **Scalability**: Transformers scale well with data and compute.
- **Versatility**: Can be used for translation, summarization, question answering, etc.

---

## 📚 Summary

| Component | Purpose |
|----------|---------|
| **Embeddings** | Convert words into vectors |
| **Positional Encoding** | Add sequence order info |
| **Self-Attention** | Model relationships between words |
| **Multi-Head Attention** | Capture multiple types of relationships |
| **Feed-Forward Networks** | Add non-linearity and complexity |
| **Residuals & Norms** | Stabilize training |
| **Encoder/Decoder** | Process input and generate output |

---

Seveda! **Transformator** je globoka umetna nevronska mreža, ki je bila predstavljena v članku **"Attention Is All You Need"** (2017) avtorjev Vaswani in drugih. Ta arhitektura je revolucionirala obdelavo naravnega jezika (NLP) in postala osnova za velike jezikovne modele (LLMs), kot so BERT, GPT in njihove izboljšave.

Tukaj je razlaga delovanja Transformatorja s poudarkom na njegovih ključnih sestavnih delih in arhitekturi.

---

## 🧠 **Glavni pregled**

Tradicionalni modeli, kot so RNN (rekurzivne nevronske mreže), obdelujejo zaporedja po en element naenkrat, kar omejuje paralelnost in hitrost. V nasprotju s tem **Transformator** obdela **celotno zaporedje hkrati**, s pomočjo mehanizma, imenovanega **samo-pozornost**, ki modelira odnose med besedami ne glede na njihovo razdaljo v zaporedju.

Transformator je sestavljen iz **kodirnik-dekodirnik strukuture**, vendar so sodobni LLMs, kot je GPT, **samo dekodirnik**, medtem ko so modeli, kot je BERT, **samo kodirnik**.

---

## 🏗️ **Arhitektura Transformatorja**

### 1. **Vstavljanje vhodnih podatkov**
- Besede (ali podbesede) so pretvorjene v numerične **vektorske predstavitve (embeddings)** s fiksno dolžino (npr. 512 ali 768 dimenzij).
- Vsakemu mestu v zaporedju je dodeljena tudi **pozicijska informacija**, ki modela informira o vrstnem redu besed, saj jih ne obdeluje zaporedno.

---

### 2. **Mehanizem samo-pozornosti''
To je **glavna inovacija** Transformatorja.

#### 🎯 Kaj je samo-pozornost?

Samo-pozornost omogoča, da vsaka beseda v zaporedju posvetiti "pozornost" ** vsem ostalim besedam**, pri čemer izračuna uteženo vsoto odnosov med besedami.

#### 🧮 Kako deluje:

Vsaka beseda se transformira v tri vektorske predstavitve:
- **Poizvedba (Q)**: Kaj iščem?
- **Ključ (K)**: Kaj predstavljam?
- **Vrednost (V)**: Katere informacije dajem?

Ocena pozornosti za par besed se izračuna kot:

$$
\text{Samo-pozornost}(Q, K, V) = \text{softmax}\left(\frac{QK^T}{\sqrt{d_k}}\right)V
$$

Kjer:
- $ d_k $ je dimenzija vektorja ključa (faktor za stabilizacijo gradientov).

To daje **kontekstualno predstavitev** vsake besede, ki temelji na njenih odnosih z vsemi ostalimi besedami v zaporedju.

#### 🔄 Večglava pozornost

- Večglava pozornost se uporablja paralelno, da zajame **različne‍rste odnosov** (npr. sintaktične, semantične).
- Izhodi vseh glav so združeni in linearno transformirani.

---

### 3. **Mreža za nadaljnjo obdelavo položajev**

Po fazi pozornosti je vsak položaj poslan skozi **nevronsko mrežo za nadaljnjo obdelavo (fed forward neural network)** (običajno sta to dve linearni plasti z ReLU vmesno plastjo). To doda nelinearnosti in pomaga modelu pri učenju kompleksnejših vzorcev.

---

### 4. **Normalizacija plasti in preostalne povezave**

Vsak del ali podplasti (pozornost in nadaljnja obdelava) je sledil:
- **Preostalna povezava (skip connection)**: Pomaga pri toku gradientov v globokh mrežah.
- **Normalizacija plasti**: Normalizira vhode glede na dimenzijo značilnosti.

---

### 5. **Kodirnik vs. dekodirnik**

#### 🧱 **Kodirnik**
- Vhod: Zaporedje všitih besed + pozicijske informacije.
- Plasti:
  - Večglava samo-pozornost.
  - Mreža za nadaljnjo obdelavo položajev.
- Izhod: Kontekstualne predstavitve vhoda.

#### 🔍 **Dekordirnik**
- Vhod: zaporedje ciljev, premaknjenih v desno (ali zaporedju maske, za avtoregresivno generiranje).
- Plasti:
  - Samo-pozornost z masko (preprečuje pozornost na prihodnje žetone).
  - Pozornost kodirnik-dekodirnik (uporablja izhode kodirnika kot kluče in vrednosti).
  - Mreža za nadaljnjo obdelavo položajev.

---

## 🧠 Intuicija za Transformatorje

- **Samo-pozornost** omogoča, da se model dinamično osredotoči na relevantne dele vhoda.
- **Večglava pozornost** zajame različne vidike pomena (npr. odnose med subjektom in objektom, negacijo).
- **Paralelizacija** naredi Transformatorje veliko hitrejše za učenje kot RNN.

---

## 🤖 V velikih jezikovnih modelih (LLMs)

- **GPT-stili** modeli (npr. GPT-3, GPT-4) uporabljajo **samo dekordiranje Transformatorjev** za avtoregresivno generiranje besedila (ena beseda naenkrat).
- **BERT-stili** modeli uporabljajo **samo kodiranje Transformatorjev** za razumevanje konteksta v obeh smereh (levo in desno).
- Transformatorji so združeni v **več plasteh** (od 12 do več kot 100 v velikih modelih), kar omogoča globoko kontekstno razumevanje.

---

## 🧮 Primer: Kako GPT generira besedilo

1. Vhod: "The cat sat on the ___"
2. Vsaka beseda je všita in dodana ji je pozicijska informacija.
3. Zapovrsti skozi večplastne dekoderje.
4. Vsak sloj uporabi samo-pozornost za razumevanje konteksta.
5. Končni izhodni sloj napove naslednjo besedo (npr. "mat").

---

## 📈 Zakaj so Transformatorji močni

- **Kontekstualno razumevanje**: besede so interpretirane glede na kontekst.
- **Skalabilnost**: Transformatorji se dobro skalirajo s količino podatkov in z računalniško močjo.
- **Vsestranskost**: Uporabni so za prevajanje, povzemanje, odgovore na vprašanja ipd.

---

## 📚 Povzetek

| Kompartment | Funkcija |
|------|------------------|
| **Vstavljanje** | Preoblikovanje besed v vektorje |
| **Položajska informacija** | Dodajanje informacij o vrstnem redu zaporedja |
| **Samo-pozornost** | Modeliranje odnosov med besedami |
| **Večglava pozornost** | Zajemanje različnih vrst odnosov |
| **Mreža za nadaljnjo obdelavo položajev** | Dodajanje nelinearnosti in kompleksnosti |
| **Preostalne povezave in normalizacija plasti** | Stabilizacijatrajnenja |
| **Kodirnik/dekodirnik** | Obdelava vhoda in generiranje izhoda |

---

To create an **Azure Key Vault** using **Terraform**, you'll need to define a few key resources:

1. **Resource Group**
2. **Key Vault**
3. **Access Policies** (to allow users or services to access the Key Vault)

Here's a **basic Terraform configuration** to deploy an Azure Key Vault:

---

### ✅ Prerequisites

- Terraform installed
- Azure CLI installed and logged in
- Subscription ID or logged-in account with proper permissions

---

### 📁 `main.tf`

```hcl
provider "azurerm" {
  features {}
}

resource "azurerm_resource_group" "example" {
  name     = "my-resource-group"
  location = "East US"
}

resource "azurerm_key_vault" "example" {
  name                        = "mykeyvaultname12345"
  location                    = azurerm_resource_group.example.location
  resource_group_name         = azurerm_resource_group.example.name
  enabled_for_disk_encryption = true
  tenant_id                   = "<your-tenant-id>"

  sku_name = "standard"

  access_policy {
    tenant_id = "<your-tenant-id>"
    object_id = "<your-user-or-service-principal-object-id>"

    key_permissions = [
      "create",
      "get",
      "list",
      "restore",
      "recover"
    ]

    secret_permissions = [
      "get",
      "list",
      "set",
      "delete"
    ]

    certificate_permissions = [
      "create",
      "get",
      "list"
    ]
  }

  network_acls {
    default_action = "Allow"
    bypass         = "AzureServices"
  }
}
```

---

### 🔐 Replace placeholders:

- `<your-tenant-id>`: Azure AD tenant ID
- `<your-user-or-service-principal-object-id>`: Object ID of the user or service principal that should have access

You can find your tenant ID and object ID using Azure CLI:

```bash
az account show --query "{tenantId:tenantId, objectId:user.name}" --output tsv
```

> Note: If you're logged in as a user, `user.name` will be your email. If you're using a service principal, you'll need to get its object ID.

---

### 🧪 Optional: Add a secret to the Key Vault

```hcl
resource "azurerm_key_vault_secret" "example" {
  name         = "my-secret"
  value        = "my-secret-value"
  key_vault_id = azurerm_key_vault.example.id
}
```

---

### 🚀 Deploy

```bash
terraform init
terraform plan
terraform apply
```

---

### 🧹 Clean up

```bash
terraform destroy
```

---

### 📌 Notes

- Azure Key Vault names must be **globally unique**.
- You can use `sku_name = "premium"` if you plan to use HSM-protected keys.
- For production, use more granular access policies and consider network rules.

---

Would you like to include **Service Principal access**, **Azure AD integration**, or **RBAC instead of access policies**? Let me know and I can tailor the example!

Tukaj je **preprosta konfiguracija Terraform za namestitev Azure Key Vaulta:**

---

### ✅ Predpogoji

- nameščen Terraform
- nameščena in prijavljena Azure CLI
- ID naročnine ali prijavljeni račun z ustreznimi dovoljenji

---

### 📁 `main.tf`

```hcl
provider "azurerm" {
  features {}
}

resource "azurerm_resource_group" "example" {
  name     = "my-resource-group"
  location = "East US"
}

resource "azurerm_key_vault" "example" {
  name                        = "mykeyvaultname12345"
  location                    = azurerm_resource_group.example.location
  resource_group_name         = azurerm_resource_group.example.name
  enabled_for_disk_encryption = true
  tenant_id                   = "<your-tenant-id>"

  sku_name = "standard"

  access_policy {
    tenant_id = "<your-tenant-id>"
    object_id = "<your-user-or-service-principal-object-id>"

    key_permissions = [
      "create",
      "get",
      "list",
      "restore",
      "recover"
    ]

      "get",
      "list",
      "set",
      "delete"
    ]

    certificate_permissions = [
      "create",
      "get",

    ]
  }

    default_action = "Allow"
    bypass         = "AzureServices"
  }
}
```

---

### 🔐 Zamenjajte nadomestna imena:

- `<your-tenant-id>`: ID najemnika Azure AD
- `<your-user-or-service-principal-object-id>`: ID objekta uporabnika ali storitvenega glavnega objekta, ki naj ima dostop

ID najemnika in ID objekta lahko poiščete z Azure CLI:

```bash

```

### 🧪 Dodatno: dodajte skrivnost v Key Vault

### 📌 Opombe

- Imena Azure Key Vaulta morajo biti **svetovno enolična**.
- Če nameravate uporabljati ključe, zaščitene z HSM, lahko uporabite `sku_name = "premium"`.

Tokyo-style sushi (江戸前寿司, *Edomae-zushi*) and Osaka-style sushi (関西風寿司, *Kansai-style sushi*) have distinct differences rooted in regional traditions, preparation methods, and ingredients. Here's a breakdown:

---

### **1. Base Vinegar (Shari/Acid Rice)**
- **Tokyo-style**:  
  - Uses **white rice vinegar** for seasoning the rice.  
  - The rice is slightly **less acidic**, allowing the umami of the fish and rice to shine.  
  - The texture is often **firmer**, designed to hold up to toppings like nigiri.

- **Osaka-style**:  
  - Traditionally uses **red rice vinegar** (from sake lees), giving the rice a **milder, sweeter flavor**.  
  - The rice is softer and stickier, reflecting Kansai’s preference for delicate textures.  
  - Often mixed with **cooked kelp (kombu)** to enhance sweetness.

---

### **2. Preparation Methods**
- **Tokyo-style**:  
  - Focuses on **nigiri sushi** (hand-pressed sushi with raw fish).  
  - Fish is often **aged or cured** (e.g., with salt, kombu, or vinegar) to intensify flavor.  
  - Emphasizes **precision and artistry**, with minimalist toppings to highlight premium ingredients.

- **Osaka-style**:  
  - Originated **osechi-style sushi** (pressed sushi, like makizushi or battera).  
  - Uses **molds (oshizushi)** to shape sushi, especially for dishes like **mackerel (saba) sushi**.  
  - Incorporates **cooked or pickled ingredients** (e.g., tamago, pickled vegetables) more frequently.

---

### **3. Toppings**
- **Tokyo-style**:  
  - Prioritizes **fresh, raw fish** (e.g., tuna, sea urchin, salmon).  
  - Toppings are often **thinly sliced** to balance texture with the rice.  
  - Uses **soy sauce sparingly**, as the fish is already seasoned.

- **Osaka-style**:  
  - Features **cooked or preserved fish** (e.g., mackerel marinated in vinegar, grilled eel).  
  - Includes **vegetables** like cucumber or spinach in pressed sushi.  
  - Toppings may be **thicker** to complement the softer rice.

---

### **4. Presentation**
- **Tokyo-style**:  
  - Elegant, minimalist aesthetic.  
  - Nigiri is often served **one piece at a time** by the chef.  
  - Focuses on **seasonality** and showcasing the fish’s natural flavor.

- **Osaka-style**:  
  - More rustic, with vibrant colors from pickled ingredients or vegetables.  
  - Served in **slices or portions** from a larger pressed block (e.g., battera).  
  - Historically designed for **portability** (e.g., for picnics or street food).

---

### **5. Historical Context**
- **Tokyo-style**:  
  - Emerged in **Edo (Tokyo) in the 1800s** as a fast, street-food innovation using fresh fish from Tokyo Bay.  
  - Evolved into the **high-end sushi culture** associated with Edomae traditions today.

- **Osaka-style**:  
  - Rooted in **Kansai’s culinary heritage**, which dates back to **narezushi** (fermented fish and rice).  
  - Focused on preservation methods (e.g., vinegar-marinated fish) due to the region’s distance from the coast.

---

### **Summary Table**

| Feature               | Tokyo-style (Edomae)               | Osaka-style (Kansai)               |
|-----------------------|------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| **Vinegar**           | White rice vinegar                 | Red rice vinegar                   |
| **Rice Texture**      | Firm, less sticky                  | Soft, sticky                       |
| **Main Types**        | Nigiri, sashimi                    | Oshizushi, battera                 |
| **Toppings**          | Fresh raw fish                     | Cooked/pickled fish, vegetables    |
| **Seasoning**         | Fish often aged/curated            | Rice may include kombu             |
| **Serving Style**     | Individual pieces                  | Slices from a pressed block        |
| **Philosophy**        | Highlight premium ingredients      | Balance flavor and preservation    |

---

In essence, Tokyo-style sushi is bold, refined, and focused on raw fish, while Osaka-style is sweeter, softer, and rooted in preservation techniques. Both reflect their regions’ histories and culinary values! 🍣

Tokijski in osakanski suši imata značilne razlike, ki izhajajo iz regionalnih tradicij, metod priprave in sestavin.

---

### **1. Osnovni kis (shari/kislo riž) **
- **Tokijski suši:**  
  - Za začinjanje riža se uporablja **bel rižev kis**.  
  - Riž je nekoliko **manj kisel**, kar omogoča, da prideta do izraza okus rib in riža.  
  - Konsistenca je pogosto **trša**, zasnovana tako, da se lahko uporabi za narezke, kot so nigiri.

- **Osakanski suši:**  
  - Tradicionalno se uporablja **rumen rižev kis** (iz ostankov sakeja), ki rižu daje **blažji, slajši okus**.  
  - Riž je mehkejši in lepljivejši, kar odraža kanski okus za nežne teksture.  
  - Pogosto se meša s **kuhanimi algami (kombu)** za povečanje sladkosti.

---

### **2. Načini priprave**
- **Tokijski suši:**  
  - Osredotoča se na **nigiri suši** (ročno stisnjen suši s surovimi ribami).  
  - Ribe so pogosto **postarane ali začinjene** (npr. s soljo, kombujem ali kisom), da se okrepi okus.  
  - Poudarek je na **natančnosti in umetnosti**, z minimalističnimi dodatki, ki poudarijo vrhunske sestavine.

- **Osakanski suši:**  
  - Izvira iz **oseči sušija** (stisnjen suši, kot sta makizushi ali battera).  
  - Uporablja **modele (oshizushi)** za oblikovanje sušija, zlasti za jedi, kot je **mackerel (saba) suši**.  
  - Pogosteje vključuje **kuhane ali vložene sestavine** (npr. tamago, vložena zelenjava).

---

### **3. Dodatki**
- **Tokijski suši:**  
  - Daje prednost **svežim, surovim ribam** (npr. tunu, ježkom, lososu).  
  - Dodatki so pogosto **tanko narezani**, da se uravnovesijo teksture z rižem.  
  - Uporablja se **sojino omako skromno**, saj je riba že začinjena.

- **Osakanski suši:**  
  - Vključuje **kuhane ali konzervirane ribe** (npr. skuša v kisu, pečena jegulja).  
  - Vključuje **zelenjavo**, kot je kumare ali špinača v stisnjenem sušiju.  
  - Dodatki so lahko **debelejši**, da se ujemajo z mehkejšim rižem.

---

### **4. Predstavitev**
- **Tokijski suši:**  
  - Elegantna, minimalistična estetika.  
  - Nigiri se pogosto postreže **po en kos naenkrat**, ki ga postreže kuhar.  
  - Osredotoča se na **sezonskost** in prikazovanje naravnega okusa rib.

- **Osakanski suši:**  
  - Bolj rustikalen, z živahnimi barvami vložene zelenjave ali zelenjave.  
  - Postreženo je v **rezinah ali porcijah** iz večjega stisnjenega bloka (npr. battera).  
  - Zgodovinsko zasnovan za **prenosnost** (npr. za piknike ali ulično hrano).

---

### **5. Zgodovinski kontekst**
- **Tokijski suši:**  
  - Pojavil se je v **Edu (Tokio) v 1800-ih** kot hitra, ulične hrane inovacija z uporabo svežih rib iz tokijskega zaliva.  
  - Razvil se je v **visoko kakovostno kulturo sušija**, povezano z danes veljavnimi tradicijami Edomae.

- **Osakanski suši:**  
  - Korenine segajo v **kanski kulinarični dediščini**, ki sega v **narezushi** (fermentirane ribe in riž).  
  - Osredotočen je na metode konzerviranja (npr. ribe v kisu), ker je regija oddaljena od obale.

---

### **Povzetek tabele**

| Funkcija               | Tokijski suši (Edomae)               | Osakanski suši (Kansai)               |
|-----------------------|------------------------------------|------------------------------------|
| **Kis**           | Bel rižev kis                 | Rumen rižev kis                   |
| **Rižasta tekstura**      | Trši, manj lepljiv                  | Mehkejši, lepljivejši                       |
| **Glavni tipi**        | Nigiri, sashimi                    | Oshizushi, battera                 |
| **Dodatki**          | S sveže surove ribe                     | Kuhane/marinirane ribe, zelenjava    |
| **Začinjeno**         | Ribe so pogosto postarane/pripravljene            | Riž lahko vključuje kombu             |
| **Način postrežbe**     | Posamezni kosi                  | Rezine iz stisnjenega bloka        |
| **Filozofija**        | Poudarjanje vrhunskih sestavin      | Uravnoteženje okusa in konzerviranja    |

---

V bistvu je tokijski suši drzen, prefinjen in osredotočen na surove ribe, medtem ko je osakanski slajši, mehkejši in korenini v tehnikah konzerviranja. Oba odražata zgodovino in kulinarične vrednote svojih regij! 🍣

**Title: The Clockmaker’s Secret**

**Setting:**  
A remote, fog-shrouded village in the English countryside, circa 1898. At the edge of the village stands a grand, ivy-covered manor known as **Ashcroft Manor**, once the home of the brilliant but reclusive clockmaker, **Professor Elias Wren**.

---

### **Chapter One: The Last Tick**

Detective **Alistair Finch**, a sharp-witted investigator from Scotland Yard, is summoned to Ashcroft Manor after receiving a cryptic telegram:  
**“Professor dead. Impossible circumstances. Come at once.”**  
Signed only with a wax seal bearing the emblem of a ticking clock.

Upon arrival, Finch is greeted by **Miss Eleanor Graves**, the Professor’s ward and sole heir, and **Mr. Reginald Pritchard**, the estate’s solicitor. They lead him to the **Observatory Room**, a circular chamber at the top of the manor, where Professor Wren was found dead—slumped over his grandest creation: a massive, intricate clockwork automaton.

The room is locked from the inside. The only door is sealed with a complex mechanism requiring a unique key, which was found in the Professor’s pocket. The windows are barred and bolted shut. There is no sign of forced entry or escape.

---

### **Chapter Two: The Clockmaker’s Room**

The Observatory Room is a marvel of engineering. The walls are lined with gears, pendulums, and timepieces of all shapes and sizes. At the center stands the automaton—a life-sized mechanical figure of a woman, eerily lifelike, frozen mid-bow.

The Professor’s body shows no signs of violence. No poison. No wounds. Just... a look of terror frozen on his face, as if he’d seen something impossible.

Miss Graves explains that the Professor had been obsessed with creating a machine that could predict the future—a “Chrono-Oracle.” He had locked himself in the room two days prior, claiming he was “on the verge of revelation.”

Pritchard insists the room had been under constant watch. No one entered or left. But Finch notices something odd: the great clock in the room has stopped at exactly **3:07 a.m.**, the time of death according to the physician.

---

### **Chapter Three: The Suspects**

Finch interviews the three other residents of the manor:

1. **Miss Eleanor Graves** – The Professor’s ward. Intelligent, enigmatic. She claims she heard nothing unusual, but Finch notices she avoids looking at the automaton.

2. **Mr. Reginald Pritchard** – The solicitor. Cold, formal. He had a financial interest in the Professor’s death, as he stood to inherit a portion of the estate if Eleanor did not.

3. **Mrs. Ada Bellamy** – The housekeeper. Superstitious and frightened. She claims she heard a “loud ticking” late at night, louder than any clock she’d ever known.

There is also a fourth figure—**the automaton itself**, which Finch suspects may be more than just a machine.

---

### **Chapter Four: The Hidden Mechanism**

Finch begins to examine the room in detail. He discovers a hidden compartment behind one of the wall clocks. Inside, a journal belonging to the Professor.

The final entry reads:  
> “The Oracle works. I have seen what is to come. But it demands a price. I fear I have gone too far. If you find this, do not trust the face of time.”

Finch realizes the automaton may not be entirely mechanical. He opens a panel in its back and finds a hidden compartment containing a **mask**, a **vial of clear liquid**, and a **burnt letter** mentioning a secret society known as **The Order of the Eternal Hour**.

---

### **Chapter Five: The Revelation**

Finch deduces that the Professor had discovered a way to use the automaton to glimpse into the future—but the machine required a “sacrifice” to function. The Professor, in his final moments, may have activated the machine, only to be confronted with a vision so horrifying that it killed him of fright.

But how did the killer escape a locked room?

Finch re-examines the clock. He notices that the pendulum is slightly misaligned. When he adjusts it, a hidden panel in the floor opens, revealing a **secret passage** leading to the manor’s old catacombs.

The killer used the passage to escape after administering a paralyzing agent (the vial found in the automaton) that made the Professor believe he was dying of fright—when in fact, it was a slow, calculated murder.

---

### **Chapter Six: The Truth Unwound**

Finch confronts the killer: **Miss Eleanor Graves**.

She confesses. She was not the Professor’s ward, but a member of **The Order of the Eternal Hour**, a group that believed time could be controlled. She infiltrated the manor to steal the secret of the Chrono-Oracle. When the Professor refused to share it, she used the automaton to kill him and stage the locked-room illusion.

But she made a mistake. The clock stopped not at the time of death, but at the time the machine was activated—triggering the automaton’s hidden mechanisms and the paralyzing gas.

---

### **Epilogue: The Final Tick**

With the case solved, Finch prepares to leave. As he descends the manor steps, he hears a faint ticking behind him. He turns to see the automaton’s eyes flicker—just for a moment.

Did the Oracle truly see the future? And if so, what did it see in Finch?

He leaves the manor, the fog rolling in behind him, and the final tick echoing in his ears.

---

**The End... or is it?**  

Would you like a sequel or a version of this mystery with a different setting (e.g., sci-fi, modern day, etc.)?

**Naslov: Skrivnost urarja**

**Dogajanje:**  
Odmaknjena, meglena vasica na angleškem podeželju, okoli leta 1898. Na robu vasi stoji veličastna dvorec, prekrit z bršljanom, znan kot **Dvorec Ashcroft**, nekoč dom briljantnega, a osamljenega urarja, **profesorja Eliasa Wrena**.

---

### **Poglavje 1: Zadnji tik**

Detektiv **Alistair Finch**, pameten preiskovalec iz Scotland Yarda, je poklican v Dvorec Ashcroft, potem ko prejme kriptični telegram:  
**»Profesor mrtev. Nemogoče okoliščine. Pridite takoj.«**  
Podpisan samo z voskom, ki nosi grb tiktakanja ure.

Ob prihodu ga sprejmeta **Eleanor Graves**, profesorjeva varovanka in edina dedinja, in **Reginald Pritchard**, odvetnik posestva. Vodita ga v **Observatorijsko sobo**, okroglo sobo na vrhu dvorca, kjer je bil profesor Wren najden mrtev – sklonjen nad svojo največjo stvaritvijo: masivnim, zapletenim mehaničnim avtomatom.

Soba je zaklenjena od znotraj. Edina vrata so zatesnjena s kompleksnim mehanizmom, ki zahteva edinstven ključ, ki so ga našli v žepu profesorja. Okna so zapahnjena in zabita. Ni sledi vloma ali pobega.

---

### **Poglavje 2: Urarjeva soba**

Observatorijska soba je čudež inženirstva. Stene so obložene z zobniki, nihalom in časomeri vseh oblik in velikosti. V središču stoji avtomat – življenjsko velika mehanična figura ženske, srhljivo podobna ženski, zmrznjena sredi poklona.

Na telesu profesorja ni znakov nasilja. Ni strupa. Ni ran. Samo... izraz groze na obrazu, kot da bi videl nekaj nemogočega.

Eleanor pojasni, da je bil profesor obseden z izdelavo stroja, ki bi lahko napovedal prihodnost – »Cronovska Prerokba«. Dva dni pred smrtjo se je zaklenil v sobo in trdil, da je »na pragu odkritja«.

Pritchard zatrjuje, da je bila soba pod nenehnim nadzorom. Nihče ni vstopil ali izstopil. Toda Finch opazi nekaj čudnega: velika ura v sobi se je ustavila točno ob **3:07 zjutraj**, času smrti po izjavi zdravnika.

---

### **Poglavje 3: Osumljenci**

Finch zasliši tri druge prebivalce dvorca:

1. **Eleanor Graves** – Profesorjeva varovanka. Inteligentna, skrivnostna. Trdila je, da ni slišala ničesar nenavadnega, toda Finch opazi, da se izogiba pogledu na avtomat.

2. **Reginald Pritchard** – Odvetnik. Hladen, formalen. Imel je finančni interes za profesorjevo smrt, saj bi podedoval del posestva, če Eleanor ne bi.

3. **Ada Bellamy** – Hišna gospodinja. Supersticionozna in prestrašena. Trdila je, da je pozno ponoči slišala »glasno tiktakanje«, glasnejše kot kdaj koli prej.

Obstaja še četrta figura – **avtomat sam**, ki ga Finch sumi, da ni samo stroj.

---

### **Poglavje 4: Skriti mehanizem**

Finch začne podrobno pregledovati sobo. Odkrije skrito predelko za eno od stenskih ur. V njej je dnevnik, ki pripada profesorju.

Zadnji vnos pravi:  
> »Prerokba deluje. Videl sem, kaj prihaja. Toda zahteva davek. Bojim se, da sem šel predaleč. Če najdeš to, ne zaupaj podobi časa.«

Finch ugotovi, da avtomat morda ni popolnoma mehaničen. Odpre ploščo na njegovem hrbtu in najde skrito predelko s **masko**, **stekleničico prozorne tekočine** in **zažganim pismom**, ki omenja skrivno družbo, imenovano **Red Večne Ure**.

---

### **Poglavje 5: Razkritje**

Finch ugotovi, da je profesor odkril način, kako uporabiti avtomat za vpogled v prihodnost – toda stroj je zahteval »žrtev«, da je lahko deloval. Profesor je morda v svojih zadnjih trenutkih aktiviral stroj, ki mu je pokazal tako grozno vizijo, da ga je ubila groza.

Toda kako je morilec pobegnil iz zaklenjene sobe?

Finch ponovno pregleda uro. Opazi, da je nihalo rahlo nepravilno. Ko ga prilagodi, se odpre skrita predelka v tleh, ki razkrije **skrivni prehod** do starih katakomb dvorca.

Morilec je uporabil prehod, da je pobegnil, potem ko je profesorju dal paralitični agens (stekleničko, najdeno v avtomatu), zaradi katerega je profesor mislil, da umira od strahu – v resnici pa je šlo za počasen, premišljen umor.

---

### **Poglavje 6: Razkrita resnica**

Finch obtoži morilko: **Eleanor Graves**.

Prizna. Ni bila profesorjeva varovanka, ampak članica **Rde Večne Ure**, ki je verjela, da je mogoče obvladovati čas. Infiltrirala se je v dvorec, da bi ukradla skrivnost Cronovske Prerokbe. Ko profesor ni hotel deliti skrivnosti z njo, je uporabila avtomat, da ga ubije in prikaže iluzijo zaklenjene sobe.

Toda naredila je napako. Ura se ni ustavila ob času smrti, ampak ob času, ko je stroj aktivirala – s čimer je sprožila avtomatov skrite mehanizme in paralitični plin.

---

### **Epilog: Zadnji tik**

Zadeva je rešena. Finch se pripravlja na odhod. Ko sestopa po stopnicah dvorca, za seboj sliši šibko tiktakanje. Obrne se in vidi, da avtomatove oči utripajo – le za trenutek.

Ali je Prerokba res videla prihodnost? In če je, kaj je videla v Finchu?

Zapusti dvorec, megla se vije za njim, zadnji tik pa odmeva v njegovih ušesih.

Python is a **high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language** known for its **simplicity, readability, and versatility**. Created by **Guido van Rossum** and first released in **1991**, Python emphasizes code readability and allows developers to express concepts in fewer lines of code compared to other languages like C++ or Java.

---

### 🐍 Key Features of Python

1. **Simple and Readable Syntax**  
   Python uses indentation (whitespace) to define code blocks, which enforces clean and readable code.

2. **Interpreted Language**  
   Python code is executed line-by-line, which makes debugging easier and allows for interactive programming.

3. **Dynamically Typed**  
   You don’t need to declare variable types; Python determines the type at runtime.

4. **Automatic Memory Management**  
   Python includes automatic garbage collection, which manages memory allocation and deallocation.

5. **Cross-Platform**  
   Python runs on various operating systems: Windows, macOS, Linux, and more.

6. **Extensive Standard Library**  
   Python comes with a large standard library that includes modules for file handling, networking, regular expressions, and more.

7. **Supports Multiple Programming Paradigms**  
   - **Procedural programming**
   - **Object-oriented programming (OOP)**
   - **Functional programming**
   - **Imperative and reflective programming**

8. **Large Ecosystem and Community**  
   Python has a vast ecosystem of third-party libraries and frameworks for tasks like data analysis, machine learning, web development, automation, and more.

---

| **Scientific Computing & Visualization** | Matplotlib, Seaborn, SciPy |
| **Game Development** | Pygame |
| **Network Programming** | asyncio, socket, paramiko |
| **Desktop GUI Applications** | Tkinter, PyQt, Kivy |

### 🐾 1. **Is It Legal to Own a Ferret in California?**

**Yes, ferrets are legal in California**, but with some important caveats:

- **You must have a permit** from the **California Department of Fish and Wildlife (CDFW)**.
- Ferrets must be **obtained from a permitted source** (e.g., a licensed breeder or rescue).
- It is **illegal to release ferrets into the wild**, and they must be kept as **indoor pets only**.

### 🏫 2. **Stanford University Policies**

Stanford University has specific rules about pets in student housing:

- **Most dorms and student apartments do not allow pets**, except for **fish in tanks under 10 gallons**.
- **Service animals and emotional support animals (ESAs)** are allowed **with proper documentation and approval** through the **Office of Accessible Education (OAE)**.
- **Ferrets are not typically considered service animals**, so they would be treated as **exotic pets**, which are generally **not permitted**.

📘 You should check Stanford’s current **Residential & Dining Enterprises (R&DE) Pet Policy**:
🔗 [Stanford R&DE Policies](https://rde.stanford.edu)

---

### 🧠 3. **Even If Allowed, Is It a Good Idea?**

Even if your classmates think your ferret is adorable, consider:

- **Ferrets are high-maintenance** and require a lot of supervision, playtime, and a special diet.
- They are **nocturnal/crepuscular**, so they may be active at night and disturb roommates or neighbors.
- They can be **escape artists**, so secure housing is essential.
- You must ensure **veterinary care** is available nearby for exotic pets.

---

- **Goal:** Shift from negative self-talk to compassionate understanding.
- **Strategy:**
  - Identify and challenge **cognitive distortions** (e.g., “If I fantasize about this, it means I’m broken”).
  - Replace judgmental thoughts with **curiosity and self-compassion** (e.g., “What is this fantasy trying to tell me about my needs or emotions?”).
  - Use **journaling** to track thoughts and identify patterns.

---

- **Goal:** Reduce obsessive thinking and bring awareness to the present.

- **Strategy:**

  - Help the client **integrate** the fantasy into their self-concept in a way that feels safe and empowering.

- **Goal:** Regain balance and reduce compulsive fantasy use.

  - Explore whether the fantasy is being used to **avoid emotional discomfort or real-life connection**.

---

- **Goal:** Embrace all parts of the self, including the “taboo” or “dark” aspects.

  - Encourage **dialogue with the fantasy persona** (e.g., journaling from the perspective of the fantasy self).
  - Help the client **honor the energy of the fantasy** in safe, symbolic ways (e.g., ritual, art, role-play with consent).

If you're encountering a **merge conflict** in Git, but the **file contents are actually identical** in both branches, this is unusual — Git typically detects that there's no real conflict and handles it automatically. However, there are scenarios where Git may still report a conflict even though the changes look the same.

Let’s break down what might be happening and how to resolve it.

---

### 🔍 Why This Might Happen

Even if the **file contents are identical**, Git might still report a conflict due to:

1. **Whitespace differences** (e.g., line endings: `CRLF` vs `LF`)
2. **File mode changes** (e.g., executable bit changed)
3. **Binary file detection** (Git treats files as binary or text depending on content)
4. **Line-ending normalization settings** (`core.autocrlf` or `.gitattributes`)
5. **Merge tool misconfiguration** showing a false conflict

---

### ✅ Steps to Solve the Conflict

#### ✅ 1. **Check the actual content differences**

Use `git diff` to see what Git thinks is conflicting:

```bash
git merge --no-commit <branch-name>
git diff
```

Or:

```bash
git checkout --conflict=diff3 <file>
```

Then view the file — Git marks conflicts like this:

```
<<<<<<< HEAD
...
=======
...
>>>>>>> branch-name
```

If the content is **identical**, the diff may still show whitespace or formatting differences.

---

#### ✅ 2. **Normalize line endings and whitespace**

If the issue is whitespace or line endings:

- Check your `.gitattributes` file. You may want to normalize text files:

```gitattributes
* text=auto
```

Or, for more control:

```gitattributes
*.txt text
*.md text
*.py text
```

Then, re-normalize the file:

```bash
git add --renormalize .
```

This will re-normalize all files according to `.gitattributes`.

---

#### ✅ 3. **Mark the conflict as resolved**

If the file is truly identical and Git is mistaken, you can:

1. Open the file and remove the conflict markers (`<<<<<<<`, `=======`, `>>>>>>>`), or:
2. Use `git checkout --ours` or `--theirs` to pick one version (since they're the same, it doesn't matter):

```bash
git checkout --ours path/to/file
```

Then:

```bash
git add path/to/file
```

And complete the merge:

```bash
git commit
```

---

#### ✅ 4. **Use a merge strategy that avoids unnecessary conflicts**

You can try using the `recursive` strategy with `patience` or `ours/theirs`:

```bash
git merge -s recursive -X patience <branch>
```

Or, to prefer one side automatically:

```bash
git merge -s recursive -X ours <branch>
```

---

### 🛠️ Pro Tip: Debug with `git check-attr`

To see how Git is treating the file:

```bash
git check-attr text path/to/file
git check-attr diff path/to/file
```

---

### ✅ Summary

| Step | Action |
|------|--------|
| 1 | Use `git diff` to inspect the conflict |
| 2 | Check for whitespace, line endings, or file mode issues |
| 3 | Normalize files with `.gitattributes` and `--renormalize` |
| 4 | If files are truly identical, use `git checkout --ours` |
| 5 | Add and commit the resolved file |

---

Če imate pri združevanju v Git konflik, čeprav vsebina datotek v obeh vejah dejansko ni spremenjena, to ni običajno, saj bi Git običajno zaznal, da ni pravega konflikta, in ga rešil samodejno. Vendar pa so možni scenariji, ko Git kljub ničelnim spremembam še vedno prikaže konflik, kar lahko pomeni naslednje:

1. ***Razlike v presledkih (npr. **CRLF**  nasproti  **LF**).
2. ***Spremembe načina datoteke** (npr. spremenjena izvršna pravica).
3. ***Detekcija binarne datoteke** (Git datoteke obravnava kot binarne ali tekstovne).
4. ***Nastavitve za normalizacijo koncev vrstic** (**core.autocrlf** ali  **.gitattributes**).
5. ***Nepravilna konfiguracija orodja za združevanje**, ki prikazuje navidezen konflik.

### **Koraki za rešitev konflikta**

#### **1. Preverite dejanske vsebinske razlike**

Uporabite **git diff** za ogled, kako Git obravnava konflikt:

```bash
git merge --no-commit <ime_veje>
git diff
```

ali

```bash
git checkout --conflict=diff3 <datoteka>
```

Nato preglejte datoteko – Git označi konflikte:

```
<<<<<<< HEAD
...
=======
...
>>>>>>> ime_veje
```

Če je vsebina **enak**a, **diff** lahko še vedno prikazuje razlike pri presledkih in obliki.

#### **2. Normalizirajte konce vrstic in presledke**

Če je težava s presledki ali konci vrstic:

- Preverite datoteko .**gitattributes**. Morda jo želite normalizirati:

```gitattributes
* text=auto
```

Ali za večji nadzor:

```gitattributes
*.txt text
*.md text
*.py text
```

Nato še enkrat normalizirajte vse datoteke:

```bash
git add --renormalize .
```

To bo vse datoteke ponovno normaliziralo glede na `.gitattributes`.

#### **3. Označite konflikt kot rešenega**

Če je datoteka res enak**a,** Git pa je v zmoti:

1. Odpatite datoteko in odstranite označevalce konflikta (`<<<<<<<`, `=======`, `>>>>>>>`) Ali
2. Uporabite **git checkout --ours** ali **--theirs** da izberete eno od različic (ni pomembno, saj so enake):

```bash
git checkout --ours pot/do/datoteke
```

Nato:

```bash
git add pot/do/datoteke
```

In zaključite združevanje:

```bash
git commit
```

#### **4. Uporabite strategijo združevanja, ki se izogiba nepotrebnim konflikton**

Preizkusite lahko strategijo **recursive** z **patience** ali **ours/theirs»:

```bash
git merge -s recursive -X patience <veje>
```

Ali, da avtomatično izberete eno stran:

```bash
git merge -s recursive -X ours <veje>
```

#### **5. **Špička:** Odpravljanje napak z **git check-attr**

Za ogled, kako Git obravnava datoteko:

```bash
git check-attr text pot/do/datoteke
git check-attr diff pot/do/datoteke
```

#### **6. Povzetek**

| Korak | Akcija |
|------|--------|
| 1 | Uporabite  **git diff,** da pregledate konflikt. |
| 2 | Preverite razlike pri presledkih, koncih vrstic ali modih datoteke. |
| 3 | Normalizirajte datoteke z **.gitattributes** in  **--renormalize**.  |
| 4 | Če so datoteke v resnic**i** enake, uporabite **git checkout --ours.**  |
| 5 | Dodajte in potrdite spremenjeno datoteko.  |

### **7. Konec konflikta**

Poročajte mi, če potrebujete pomoč pri pregledu specifične datoteke ali diffa!

There are several **free software tools** you can use to **merge two directories**, depending on your operating system and your specific needs (e.g., whether you want to overwrite, skip duplicates, or merge selectively). Here are some of the best free options:

---

### 🔧 **1. FreeCommander (Windows)**
- **Platform**: Windows
- **Features**:
  - File merging with overwrite options
  - Compare directories
  - Batch rename, duplicate file search, and more
- **Why use it**: Great GUI alternative to Windows Explorer with powerful file management.
- **Website**: [https://freecommander.com/en/](https://freecommander.com/en/)

---

### 🔧 **2. rsync (Windows, macOS, Linux)**
- **Platform**: Cross-platform (via terminal)
- **Features**:
  - Merges directories efficiently
  - Syncs files and folders
  - Can preserve permissions, timestamps, etc.
- **Example command**:
  ```bash
  rsync -av /source_directory/ /destination_directory/
  ```
- **Why use it**: Extremely powerful and flexible, especially for advanced users.
- **Note**: On Windows, you can use rsync via **Cygwin**, **WSL**, or **Git Bash**.

---

### 🔧 **3. Unison (Windows, macOS, Linux)**
- **Platform**: Cross-platform
- **Features**:
  - Bi-directional sync (great for merging)
  - GUI and command-line versions
- **Why use it**: Handles two-way synchronization safely.
- **Website**: [https://www.cis.upenn.edu/~bcpierce/unison/](https://www.cis.upenn.edu/~bcpierce/unison/)

---

### 🔧 **4. Meld (Linux, Windows, macOS)**
- **Platform**: Cross-platform
- **Features**:
  - Folder comparison and merging
  - Visual diff tool
- **Why use it**: Great for comparing and selectively merging files and directories.
- **Website**: [https://meldide.org/](https://meldide.org/)

---

### 🔧 **5. SyncToy (Windows)**
- **Platform**: Windows only
- **Features**:
  - Folder merging and syncing
  - Simple interface by Microsoft
- **Why use it**: Lightweight and easy to use.
- **Website**: [https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=15155](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=15155)

---

### 🔧 **6. Python Script (Cross-platform)**
If you're comfortable with scripting, you can write a simple Python script using `shutil` or `os` to merge directories with custom logic.

Example:
```python
import shutil
import os

def merge_directories(src, dst):
    for root, dirs, files in os.walk(src):
        rel_path = os.path.relpath(root, src)
        dst_dir = os.path.join(dst, rel_path)
        os.makedirs(dst_dir, exist_ok=True)
        for file in files:
            src_file = os.path.join(root, file)
            dst_file = os.path.join(dst_dir, file)
            if not os.path.exists(dst_file):
                shutil.copy2(src_file, dst_dir)

merge_directories("path/to/source", "path/to/destination")
```

To split a string into an array of words in Python, you can use the built-in `split()` method. By default, `split()` divides a string into a list using whitespace as the delimiter.

### Example 1: Basic usage of `split()`

```python
text = "Hello world this is Python"
words = text.split()
print(words)
```

**Output:**
```
['Hello', 'world', 'this', 'is', 'Python']
```

### Example 2: Splitting with a custom delimiter

If your string uses a specific delimiter (like a comma or hyphen), you can pass it as an argument to `split()`.

```python
text = "apple,banana,orange,grape"
words = text.split(',')
print(words)
```

**Output:**
```
['apple', 'banana', 'orange', 'grape']
```

### Example 3: Limiting the number of splits

You can use the `maxsplit` parameter to limit how many times the string is split.

```python
text = "one two three four"
words = text.split(maxsplit=2)
print(words)
```

**Output:**
```
['one', 'two', 'three four']
```

These examples demonstrate how flexible the `split()` method is when processing strings in Python.

V Pythonu lahko niz razdelite na seznam besed z vgrajeno metodo `split()`. Privzeto `split()` razdeli niz na seznam z uporabo presledkov kot ločevalnika.

### Primer 1: Osnovna uporaba `split()`

```python
besedilo = "Pozdravljen svet, to je Python"
seznam = besedilo.split()
print(seznam)
```

**Izhod:**
```
['Pozdravljen', 'svet', 'to', 'je', 'Python']
```

### Primer 2: Razdelitev z prilagojenim ločevalnikom

Če vaš niz uporablja določen ločevalnik (kot je vejica ali vezaj), ga lahko prenesete kot argument `split()`-ju.

```python
besedilo = "jabolko,banana,pomaranča,grozdje"
seznam = besedilo.split(',')
print(seznam)
```

**Izhod:**
```
['jabolko', 'banana', 'pomaranča', 'grozdje']
```

### Primer 3: Omejevanje števila razdelitev

S parametrom `maxsplit` lahko omejite, kolikokrat naj bo niz razdeljen.

```python
besedilo = "ena dve tri štiri"
seznam = besedilo.split(maxsplit=2)
print(seznam)
```

**Izhod:**
```
['ena', 'dve', 'tri štiri']
```

Ti primeri prikazujejo, kako vsestranski je `split()` pri obdelavi nizov v Pythonu.

The command:

```bash
git remote update origin --prune
```

does **two main things**:

---

### 1. **Fetches updates from the remote repository (`origin`)**

- It runs `git fetch` against the remote called `origin`.
- This updates all of your **remote-tracking branches** under `origin/`, such as `origin/main`, `origin/feature-branch`, etc.
- These branches will now reflect the latest state of the remote repository.

---

### 2. **Prunes stale remote-tracking branches**

- The `--prune` flag ensures that any **remote-tracking branches that no longer exist on the remote (`origin`)** are deleted locally.
- For example, if someone deleted a branch like `feature-old` on the remote repository, this command removes your local `origin/feature-old` tracking branch.

---

### Why use it?

This is useful to:
- Keep your local repository in sync with the remote.
- Avoid clutter from old branches that were deleted upstream.

---

### Equivalent to:

```bash
git fetch origin --prune
```

or

```bash
git fetch --all --prune
```

(If you have multiple remotes and want to update them all.)

---

### Note:
- It does **not** update or modify your **local branches** (like `main`, `dev`, etc.) unless you have configured tracking and use `git pull` or merge manually.
- It only updates **remote-tracking branches** (like `origin/main`).

---

### Summary

```bash
git remote update origin --prune
```

> Fetches the latest changes from `origin` and removes any stale `origin/...` branches that no longer exist on the remote.

Ukaz:

```bash
git remote update origin --prune
```

naredi **dve glavni stvari**:

---

### 1. **Pridobi posodobitve iz oddaljenega repozitorija (`origin`)**

- Zažene `git fetch` za oddaljen repozitorij, imenovan `origin`.
- To posodobi vse vaše **oddaljene sledeče veje** pod `origin/`, kot so `origin/main`, `origin/feature-branch` itd.
- Te veje bodo zdaj odražale najnovejše stanje oddaljenega repozitorija.

---

### 2. **Odstrani zastarele oddaljene sledeče veje**

- S zastavico `--prune` zagotovite, da se lokalno izbrišejo vse **oddaljene sledeče veje**, ki ne obstajajo več na oddaljenem repozitoriju (`origin`).
- Če je nekdo izbrisal vejo, kot je `feature-old` v oddaljenem repozitoriju, bo ta ukaz odstranil vašo lokalno sledenje veji `origin/feature-old`.

---

### Zakaj ga uporabljati?

Ta ukaz je uporaben, ker:
- Ohranja vaš lokalni repozitorij sinhroniziran z oddaljenim.
- Preprečuje, da bi se pojavila zmeda zaradi starih vej, ki so bile izbrisane na oddaljenem repozitoriju.

---

### Enakovredno kot:

```bash
git fetch origin --prune
```

ali

```bash
git fetch --all --prune
```

(Če imate več oddaljenih repozitorijev in jih želite posodobiti vse.)

---

### Opomba:
- **Ne posodobi** ali spremeni **lokalnih vej** (kot so `main`, `dev` itd.), razen če ste nastavili sledenje in ročno uporabili `git pull` ali združevanje.
- Posodobi samo **oddaljene sledeče veje** (kot je `origin/main`).

---

### Povzetek

```bash
git remote update origin --prune
```

> Pridobi najnovejše spremembe iz `origin` in odstrani vse zastarele veje `origin/...`, ki ne obstajajo več na oddaljenem.

To **conditionally remove `ml-auto` only on large (`lg`) and extra-large (`xl`) screens**, you need to use Tailwind's **responsive modifiers** in a way that **overrides** the `ml-auto` at larger breakpoints.

The issue with your current code:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

is that `lg:ml-0` only applies on **large screens and up**, meaning on `lg`, `xl`, and `2xl`. But `ml-auto` still applies on `lg` because it's defined earlier and Tailwind applies classes in order.

Tailwind applies utility classes in **order**, so later classes will override earlier ones at the same breakpoint.

---

### ✅ Correct Approach

To ensure that `ml-auto` **only applies on small and medium screens**, and **not on `lg` and above**, you should scope `ml-auto` to only apply **before** `lg`:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] sm:ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

However, Tailwind doesn't provide a `sm:`-only modifier like `max-md:...`, so the best way is to **use a media query or override `ml-auto` at `lg` and above**.

---

### ✅ Best Solution Using Tailwind

Use `ml-auto` and then **override it at `lg`**:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

But to make sure `lg:ml-0` overrides `ml-auto` on large screens, you can **reorder the classes** so the override comes **after**:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

Wait — this is the same as your code. So why isn't it working?

---

### 🔍 Possible Cause: CSS Specificity or Tailwind Version

If you're using an older version of Tailwind, or if there's a **custom CSS** or **build issue**, it might not be respecting the override.

Try this instead:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

And add a bit of extra spacing or comment to make sure Tailwind parses the class correctly:

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto   lg:ml-0">
```

This ensures Tailwind sees the `lg:ml-0` as a separate class and applies it properly.

---

### ✅ Final Working Example

```html
<div class="max-w-[284px] xl:max-w-[1000px] ml-auto lg:ml-0">
```

This will:
- Apply `ml-auto` on small and medium screens.
- Apply `ml-0` on `lg` and larger screens.

If it's still not working:
- Make sure you're not using `!important` or custom CSS that overrides Tailwind.
- Try restarting your Tailwind build process.
- Consider using a custom class in your CSS with `@media` queries if Tailwind isn't working as expected.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a powerful and transformative technology, and like any powerful technology, it carries both **opportunities and risks**. Whether AI is "dangerous" depends on **how it is developed, deployed, and regulated**. Here's a balanced overview of the potential **benefits** and **dangers** of AI:

---

### ✅ Benefits of AI

1. **Healthcare Advancements**  
   - AI can assist in diagnosing diseases, developing new drugs, and personalizing treatment plans.
   
2. **Increased Efficiency**  
   - Automating repetitive tasks in industries like manufacturing, logistics, and customer service can boost productivity and reduce costs.

3. **Scientific Discovery**  
   - AI accelerates research in fields like climate science, physics, and biology.

4. **Improved Safety**  
   - AI systems can perform dangerous tasks (e.g., in mining, disaster response, or space exploration) to reduce human risk.

5. **Enhanced Decision-Making**  
   - AI can analyze large datasets to provide insights for better business, policy, and personal decisions.

---

### ⚠️ Potential Dangers of AI

1. **Job Displacement**  
   - Automation powered by AI could replace jobs, especially in industries like transportation, manufacturing, and customer service, leading to economic disruption.

2. **Bias and Discrimination**  
   - AI systems can inherit biases from training data, leading to unfair outcomes in hiring, policing, lending, and more.

3. **Misinformation and Deepfakes**  
   - AI can generate convincing fake images, videos, and text, which can be used to manipulate public opinion or commit fraud.

4. **Autonomous Weapons**  
   - AI-powered military systems could make decisions without human oversight, increasing the risk of unintended conflicts or unethical warfare.

5. **Loss of Control (Existential Risk)**  
   - Some experts worry about **superintelligent AI** — a system that surpasses human intelligence and could act in ways that are misaligned with human values. This is more speculative but a concern among researchers.

6. **Privacy Concerns**  
   - AI systems often rely on vast amounts of data, raising concerns about surveillance, data misuse, and erosion of personal privacy.

---

### 🛡️ Mitigating the Risks

To ensure AI remains beneficial and safe, experts and organizations are working on:

- **Ethical AI Development** — Ensuring fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI systems.
- **Regulation and Policy** — Governments are drafting laws (e.g., the EU AI Act) to govern AI use.
- **AI Safety Research** — Organizations like OpenAI, DeepMind, and academic institutions are researching how to align AI with human values.
- **Public Awareness and Education** — Helping people understand AI and its implications.

---

### 🧠 Final Thought

AI is not inherently dangerous, but it **can be misused or cause unintended harm** if not properly managed. With thoughtful development, oversight, and global cooperation, AI has the potential to be one of humanity’s most beneficial tools.

If you're curious about a specific aspect of AI safety — like autonomous weapons, deepfakes, or job automation — I’d be happy to go deeper!

Umetna inteligenca (UI) je močna in preoblikovalna tehnologija, ki pa, tako kot vsaka močna tehnologija, prinaša tako **priložnosti kot tveganja**. Ali je UI »nevarna« je odvisno od **načina, kako jo razvijamo, uporabljamo in reguliramo**. Tukaj je uravnotežen pregled potencialnih **prednosti** in **nevarnosti** UI:

---

### ✅ Prednosti UI

1. **Napredki v zdravstvu**  
   - UI lahko pomaga pri diagnozah bolezni, razvoju novih zdravil in personaliziranih načrtih zdravljenja.

2. **Povečana učinkovitost**  
   - Avtomatizacija ponavljajočih se opravil v panogah, kot so proizvodnja, logistika in storitve za stranke, lahko poveča produktivnost in zmanjša stroške.

3. **Znanstvena odkritja**  
   - UI pospeši raziskave na področjih, kot so podnebne znanosti, fizika in biologija.

4. **Izboljšana varnost**  
   - Sistemi UI lahko opravljajo nevarne naloge (npr. v rudarstvu, odzivanju na nesreče ali raziskovanju vesolja), da bi zmanjšali tveganja za ljudi.

5. **Izboljšano odločanje**  
   - UI lahko analizira velike zbirke podatkov, da zagotovi vpogled za boljše poslovne, politične in osebne odločitve.

---

### ⚠️ Potencialne nevarnosti UI

1. **Izguba delovnih mest**  
   - Avtomatizacija, ki jo poganja UI, bi lahko zamenjala delovna mesta, zlasti v panogah, kot so transport, proizvodnja in storitve za stranke, kar bi lahko povzročilo gospodarske motnje.

2. **Pristranskost in diskriminacija**  
   - Sistemi UI lahko podedujejo pristranskosti iz učnih podatkov, kar vodi do nepravičnih rezultatov pri zaposlovanju, policijskih postopkih, posojanju in drugje.

3. **Dezinformacije in deepfakes**  
   - UI lahko ustvari prepričljive lažne slike, videoposnetke in besedila, ki se lahko uporabijo za manipulacijo javnega mnenja ali goljufanje.

4. **Samodejno orožje**  
   - Vojaški sistemi, ki jih poganja UI, bi lahko sprejemali odločitve brez človeškega nadzora, kar bi povečalo tveganje za nenamerne konflikte ali neetično vojskovanje.

5. **Izguba nadzora (eksistenčno tveganje)**  
   - Nekateri strokovnjaki so zaskrbljeni zaradi **superinteligentne UI** – sistema, ki presega človeško inteligenco in bi lahko deloval na načine, ki niso usklajeni s človeškimi vrednotami. To je bolj spekulativno, vendar je skrb med raziskovalci.

6. **Skrb za zasebnost**  
   - Sistemi UI pogosto temeljijo na ogromnih količinah podatkov, kar zbuja zaskrbljenost glede nadzora, zlorabe podatkov in erozije osebne zasebnosti.

---

### 🛡️ Omilitev tveganj

Za zagotovitev, da UI ostane koristna in varna, strokovnjaki in organizacije delajo na:

- **Etičnem razvoju UI** – zagotavljanje pravičnosti, preglednosti in odgovornosti v sistemih UI.
- **Ureditvi in politiki** – vlade pripravljajo zakone (npr. Akt EU o UI), ki bodo urejali uporabo UI.
- **Raziskavah varnosti UI** – organizacije, kot so OpenAI, DeepMind in akademske institucije, raziskujejo, kako UI uskladiti s človeškimi vrednotami.
- **Ozaveščanju in izobraževanju javnosti** – pomoč ljudem pri razumevanju UI in njenih posledic.

---

### 🧠 Zaključna misel

UI sama po sebi ni nevarna, lahko pa se jo zlorabi ali povzroči nenamerno škodo, če ni ustrezno upravljana. Z premišljenim razvojem, nadzorom in globalnim sodelovanjem ima UI potencial, da postane eno najkoristnejših orodij človeštva.

Če vas zanima določen vidik varnosti UI – kot so samodejno orožje, deepfakes ali avtomatizacija delovnih mest – bom z veseljem razpravljala o tem!

Cooking a stir fry is a quick, healthy, and delicious way to enjoy a variety of vegetables, proteins, and sauces. Here's a step-by-step guide to making a basic stir fry:

---

### 🥘 **Ingredients**
You can customize these based on your preferences:

#### Proteins (choose one or more):
- Chicken breast, sliced
- Beef (sirloin or flank steak), thinly sliced
- Tofu, cubed
- Shrimp
- Pork, sliced
- Eggs (for a vegetarian version)

#### Vegetables (use any combination):
- Bell peppers (any color)
- Broccoli
- Carrots, julienned
- Snap peas or green beans
- Zucchini or yellow squash
- Onions (red or yellow)
- Garlic, minced
- Ginger, minced or grated
- Baby corn
- Bok choy or spinach
- Mushrooms

#### Sauce (adjust to taste):
- Soy sauce (low sodium preferred)
- Oyster sauce (optional)
- Hoisin sauce (optional)
- Sesame oil
- Rice vinegar or lime juice
- Honey or brown sugar
- Chili garlic sauce or sriracha (for heat)
- Cornstarch + water (to thicken, optional)

#### Other:
- Cooking oil (vegetable, canola, peanut, or sesame oil)
- Cooked rice, noodles, or quinoa (for serving)
- Sesame seeds, chopped green onions, or cilantro (for garnish)

---

### 🍳 **Equipment**
- Wok or large skillet
- Spatula or wooden spoon
- Mixing bowls
- Measuring spoons

---

### 🔥 **Instructions**

#### 1. **Prepare Ingredients**
- **Chop vegetables** into bite-sized, uniform pieces.
- **Slice meat or tofu** thinly across the grain (for tenderness).
- **Mix the sauce** in a small bowl: Combine soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, vinegar, honey, chili sauce, etc.
- **Cook rice or noodles** if serving with them.

#### 2. **Prep Your Station**
- Have all your ingredients ready and within reach (mise en place).

#### 3. **Heat the Wok or Pan**
- Place your wok or skillet over **high heat**.
- Add **1–2 tablespoons of oil** (neutral oil like vegetable or peanut oil).
- Let it heat until just shimmering or smoking lightly.

#### 4. **Cook the Protein**
- Add your protein in a single layer and let it cook undisturbed for 1–2 minutes to get a nice sear.
- Stir-fry until almost cooked through. Remove and set aside.

#### 5. **Cook the Aromatics and Vegetables**
- Add a bit more oil if needed.
- Cook **garlic and ginger** for 30 seconds (don’t burn them).
- Add **hard vegetables first** (like carrots, broccoli, onions) and stir-fry for 2–3 minutes.
- Add **softer vegetables** (like peppers, mushrooms, zucchini) and stir-fry for another 1–2 minutes.

#### 6. **Combine Everything**
- Return the cooked protein to the pan.
- Stir to combine everything.

#### 7. **Add the Sauce**
- Pour in your sauce and stir well to coat everything.
- Cook for 1–2 more minutes until the sauce thickens slightly and everything is heated through.

#### 8. **Serve**
- Serve immediately over **rice, noodles, or quinoa**.
- Garnish with **sesame seeds, green onions, or cilantro** if desired.

---

### ✅ **Tips for Success**
- **Don’t overcrowd the pan** – cook in batches if needed.
- **Keep things moving** – stir constantly to prevent burning.
- **Use high heat** – this is key to getting that smoky (wok-hei) flavor.
- **Prep everything before you start cooking** – stir fry moves fast!

---

Kuhanje na žaru je hiter, zdrav in okusen način za uživanje v različnih vrstah zelenjave, beljakovin in omak. Tukaj je korak za korakom navodilo za pripravo osnovne jedi na žaru:

---

### 🥘 **Sestavine**
Te lahko prilagodite po svojem okusu:

#### Beljakovine (izberite eno ali več):
- Piščančje prsi, narezane na rezine
- Govedina (pleče ali hrbtni zrezek), tanko narezana
- Tofu, narezan na kocke
- Škampi
- Svinjina, narezana na rezine
- Jajca (za vegetarijansko različico)

#### Zelenjava (uporabite poljubno kombinacijo):
- Paprike (katerikoli barvi)
- Brokoli
- Korenje, narezano na rezine
- Grah ali stročji fižol
- Bučke ali rumene bučke
- Čebula (rdeča ali rumena)
- Česen, drobno sesekljan
- Ingver, drobno sesekljan ali nariban
- Korenček
- Bok choy ali špinača
- Gobe

#### Omaka (prilagodite po okusu):
- Sojina omaka (priporočljivo nizka vsebnost natrija)
- Ostrigova omaka (neobvezno)
- Hoisin omaka (neobvezno)
- Sezamovo olje
- Rižev kis ali limeta sok
- Med ali rjavi sladkor
- Chili česnova omaka ali sriracha (za vročino)
- Koruzni škrob + voda (za zgostitev, neobvezno)

#### Drugo:
- Olje za kuhanje (rastlinsko, repično, arašidovo ali sezamovo olje)
- Kuhan riž, testenine ali kvinoja (za postrežbo)
- Sezamova semena, nasekljana zelena čebula ali koriander (za dekoracijo)

---

### 🍳 **Oprema**
- Wok ali velika ponvica
- Lopatica ali lesena žlica
- Mešalne sklede
- Merilne žlice

---

### 🔥 **Navodila**

#### 1. **Pripravite sestavine**
- **Zelenjavo narežite** na grižljaje, enako velike kose.
- **Meso ali tofu** narežite na tanke rezine, ki potekajo prečno na vlakna (za mehkejšo teksturo).
- **Zmešajte omako** v majhni skledi: združite sojino omako, ostrigovo omako, sezamovo olje, kis, med, čili omako itd.
- **Skuhajte riž ali testenine**, če jih boste postregli zraven.

#### 2. **Pripravite delovno površino**
- Imejte vse sestavine pripravljene in pri roki (mise en place).

#### 3. **Segrejte wok ali ponev**
- Postavite wok ali ponev na **močan ogenj**.
- Dodajte **1–2 žlici olja** (nevtralno olje, kot je rastlinsko ali arašidovo olje).
- Pustite, da se segreje, dokler ne zadiši ali rahlo kadi.

#### 4. **Skuhajte beljakovine**
- Dodajte beljakovine v enem sloju in jih pustite, da se kuhajo nemoteno 1–2 minuti, da dobijo lepo zapečeno skorjico.
- Kuhajte na žaru, dokler niso skoraj kuhane. Odstranite in odstavite.

#### 5. **Skuhajte dišave in zelenjavo**
- Dodajte še malo olja, če je potrebno.
- Kuhajte **česen in ingver** 30 sekund (ne smete ju prežgati).
- Najprej dodajte **tršo zelenjavo** (kot je korenje, brokoli, čebula) in kuhajte na žaru 2–3 minute.
- Dodajte **mehkejšo zelenjavo** (kot so paprike, gobe, bučke) in kuhajte na žaru še 1–2 minuti.

#### 6. **Vse združite**
- V ponev vrnite kuhane beljakovine.
- Premešajte, da se vse združi.

#### 7. **Dodajte omako**
- Vlijte omako in dobro premešajte, da se vse prepoji z omako.
- Kuhajte še 1–2 minuti, da se omaka rahlo zgosti in se vse dobro segreje.

#### 8. **Postrezite**
- Takoj postrezite z **rižem, testeninami ali kvinojo**.
- Po želji okrasite s **sezamovihimi semeni, zeleno čebulo ali koriandrom**.

---

### ✅ **Nasveti za uspeh**
- **Ne prenapolnite ponve** – če je potrebno, kuhajte v več delih.
- **Stvari naj se premikajo** – neprestano mešajte, da se ne zažgejo.
- **Uporabite močan ogenj** – to je ključnega pomena za pridobitev dimljenega (wok-hei) okusa.
- **Pripravite vse, preden začnete kuhati** – žar se hitro pripravi!

---

¡Feliz Cinco de Mayo! That sounds like a fun celebration — enjoy the fiesta! If you're bringing a side dish to share, here are some **traditional and crowd-pleasing Mexican-inspired side dishes** that will fit right in:

---

### 🌮 **Top Side Dish Ideas for Cinco de Mayo:**

#### 1. **Mexican Rice (Arroz Rojo)**
- A flavorful, tomato-based rice with onions, garlic, and sometimes peas or carrots.
- Easy to make and always a hit.

#### 2. **Refried Beans (Frijoles Refritos)**
- Creamy and savory, refried beans are a staple at any Mexican gathering.
- You can make them from scratch or jazz up a can with cumin, garlic, and onion.

#### 3. **Elote (Mexican Street Corn)**
- Grilled corn on the cob slathered with mayo, cotija cheese, chili powder, and lime.
- Super flavorful and always a crowd favorite.

#### 4. **Coleslaw (Mexican Style)**
- Creamy coleslaw with a touch of lime and cilantro adds a refreshing crunch.
- Great with tacos or carnitas.

#### 5. **Guacamole with Veggie Sticks or Chips**
- A fresh guac with avocado, lime, tomato, onion, and cilantro.
- Serve with tortilla chips, jicama sticks, or bell pepper slices.

#### 6. **Pico de Gallo**
- A fresh salsa made with tomatoes, onions, cilantro, jalapeños, and lime.
- Light and perfect as a side or dip.

#### 7. **Cornbread (Mexican Style)**
- Sweet or savory cornbread with a hint of chili or cheese.
- Pairs well with rice, beans, or soups.

#### 8. **Pickled Jalapeños or Vegetables (Escabeche)**
- Tangy, slightly spicy pickled veggies add a zesty side to the table.
- Great with tacos or grilled meats.

#### 9. **Avocado Cucumber Salad**
- A light, refreshing salad with avocado, cucumber, red onion, cilantro, and lime dressing.
- Balances heavier dishes.

#### 10. **Tortilla Chips & Salsa Trio**
- If you're short on time, grab or make a few kinds of salsas (salsa verde, chipotle, mango) and a big bowl of chips.
- Easy and always appreciated.

---

### 🎁 Pro Tip:
Bring your dish in a disposable container or clearly labeled dish you want returned. Add a little decoration like a lime wedge or cilantro sprig for presentation!

---

Feliz Cinco de Mayo! Zdi se, da bo to zabavno praznovanje – uživajte v festivalu! Verjetno vas zanima kakšna tradicionalna, priljubljena mehiška priloga, ki bo pravšnja za takšno priložnost:

---

### 🌮 **Najboljše predloge za prilogo na Cinco de Mayo:**

#### 1. **Mehiški riž (Arroz Rojo)**
- Okusen riž na bazi paradižnika s čebulo, česnom, včasih se doda grah ali korenje.
- Preprost za pripravo in vedno uspešen.

#### 2. **Refriedi fižoli (Frijoles refritos)**
- Kremasti in okusni, refriedi fižoli so obvezen del vsakega mehiškega zbiranja.
- Lahko jih pripravite iz konzerviranih ali pa dodate kumino, česen in čebulo.

#### 3. **Elote (Mehiška koruza na žaru)**
- Koruza na žaru, mazana z majonezo, posuta s cotija sirom, čilijem v prahu in limono.
- Zelo okusna in vedno priljubljena.

#### 4. **Coleslaw (Mehiški stil)**
- Kremast coleslaw z dodatkom limete in koriandra doda svežino in hrust.
- Odlično se ujema s tacos ali carnitas.

#### 5. **Guacamole s palčkami iz zelenjave ali čipsa**
- Svež guacamole z avokadom, limono, paradižnikom, čebulo in koriandrom.
- Postrezite s tortilja čipsi, palčkami iz jicame ali rezinami rdeče paprike.

#### 6. **Pico de Gallo**
- Sveža salsa iz paradižnika, čebule, koriandra, jalapenos in limete.
- Lahka in odlična kot priloga ali dip.

#### 7. **Koruzni kruh (Mehiški stil)**
- Sladki ali slan koruzni kruh z dodatkom čilija ali sira.
- Lepo se poda k rižu, fižolu ali juham.

#### 8. **Piklirani jalapenos ali zelenjava (Escabeche)**
- Pikantno, rahlo kislo vloženo zelenjavo, ki dodata zesti pridih.
- Super za tos ali žar.

#### 9. **Solata iz avokada in kumare**
- Lahka, sveža solata iz avokada, kumare, rdeče čebule, koriandra in limetine polivke.
- Uravnoteži težje jedi.

#### 10. **Tortilja čips & trio sals**
- Kadar nimate veliko časa, pripravite ali kupite nekaj vrst sals (zelena salsa, s chipotlejem, mangom) in veliko skledo čipsa.
- Enostavno in vedno priljubljeno.

---

### 🎁 Nasvet:
Prinesite jed v plastičnem lončku ali jasno označite, kateri lonček želite nazaj. Za še večji vtis dodajte rezino limete ali vejico koriandra.

Said the only way to break the curse was to pay $3,000 to some “spiritual healer” in Ocho Rios. And he needed *my* help because we were “family.”

Now, I’m thinking, this dude’s either got a wild imagination or he’s been binge-watching too much Shondaland. But I played along for a bit, like *“Yo, what color was the goat?”* He says, *“White, like snow, bro.
